[{'created': '2018-05-11 14:34:46.000000000', 'message': "vars: Do not install build dependencies for distro installs

The cinder_distro_packages contain packages which are build dependencies
to the 'PIP' ones so we don't need to install them when we are using the
Cinder distribution packages. This also renames the '*cinder_wsgi_bin'
to '*cinder_uwsgi_bin' since it refers to the actual uwsgi package.
Finally, we add the missing 'install_method' conditional when recording
the local facts.

Change-Id: Ib6f3a85dd20c61611e968baffd4e3c725d9e39b3
Implements: blueprint openstack-distribution-packages

commit_message:
vars: Do not install build dependencies for distro installs

The cinder_distro_packages contain packages which are build dependencies
to the 'PIP' ones so we don't need to install them when we are using the
Cinder distribution packages. This also renames the '*cinder_wsgi_bin'
to '*cinder_uwsgi_bin' since it refers to the actual uwsgi package.
Finally, we add the missing 'install_method' conditional when recording
the local facts.

Change-Id: Ib6f3a85dd20c61611e968baffd4e3c725d9e39b3
Implements: blueprint openstack-distribution-packages

commit_message:
Add V1DeleteOptions when deleting Service

Today Python kubernetes client 6.0.0 was released. It brought
non-backward-compatible change into delete_namespaced_service() method.
This commit fixes that by adding new required parameter.

Change-Id: I207d914020e245e931c8f8b55deef2f8e2cf0e4f
Closes-Bug: 1763340

commit_message:
Add arm64 support for elasticsearch and kibana images.

Ideally we should have official arm64 builds for both components
at the upstream distributions. Since they are not available,
we can use unofficial repositories until the official support
is implemented.

Closes-Bug: #1770485

Change-Id: I7a844cf1d6ae6db168f8f96a6a9b420a06cb2b86
Signed-off-by: Jorge Niedbalski <jorge.niedbalski@linaro.org>

commit_message:
Convert nic templates to new format before starting fast forward

This change converts the nic templates in use by the deployment
to the new templates format by using the conversion script provided
in tht.

Change-Id: I3fae48e830c8943a5b5fc79de80b1bdb80bc911d

[{'account_id': 24072, 'date': '2018-01-22 21:50:40.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 24072, 'date': '2018-01-22 21:51:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow-1'}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2018-01-23 02:56:03.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: Patch Set 1 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2018-01-23 02:56:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Workflow-1

just a rebase here'}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2018-01-23 02:59:07.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3: Patch Set 2 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2018-01-23 03:51:56.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Workflow-1

The theory here being that this partition configuration will be suitable for any users, pc or EFI?

we're usually pretty conservative with backwards compatibility for things like this; on one hand it doesn't seem that dangerous, but then on the other if people's root partitions move on them and they've got tooling around that, it might be a pain."}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2018-01-23 04:48:29.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

some things:

in the nodepool jobs: 

 exec_sudo: sudo: sgdisk: command not found exec_sudo /opt/stack/new/diskimage-builder/diskimage_builder/block_device/utils.py:120'

bindep would help here ... otherwise we need to add the dep into the nodepool job that installs dib

 exec_sudo: mkfs: failed to execute mkfs.vfat

this we can add to our existing hack..."}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2018-01-23 04:53:13.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4: Patch Set 3 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 24072, 'date': '2018-01-23 06:31:06.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

> The theory here being that this partition configuration will be suitable for any users, pc or EFI?

It can work for both.

> we're usually pretty conservative with backwards compatibility for
> things like this; on one hand it doesn't seem that dangerous, but
> then on the other if people's root partitions move on them and
> they've got tooling around that, it might be a pain.

We can add partition number into yaml and use it. Then make ESP/BSP partitions any (higher than 1) number so root=/dev/vda1 would still work. In CirrOS I gave 15 as partition number for ESP (no BSP there)."}, {'account_id': 24072, 'date': '2018-01-23 15:26:07.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5: Patch Set 4 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 24072, 'date': '2018-01-23 15:29:31.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6: Patch Set 5 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2018-01-25 04:28:52.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7: Patch Set 6 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2018-01-25 07:09:09.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8: Patch Set 7 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 24072, 'date': '2018-05-14 13:51:04.000000000', 'content': "Abandoned

it's done other way now"}]

commit_message:
change default image into GPT with ESP and BSP

Two new partitions added:
- ESP to get resulting image working with grub-efi
- BSP for grub-pc

Change-Id: I6904794bbce3f32a200e5f2588d19f82b00d1ab5

Cheers,
milan'}, {'account_id': 18653, 'date': '2017-04-25 10:29:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 13:

(1 comment)

Hello Nisha,

my concern about the pxe_enabled flag not being updated is pointless because pxe_enabled is meaningless w/ vmedia as a boot method, sorry for the confusion (thanks sambetts for pointing it out).

Other thing is discovery is mutually-exclusive with this manage boot feature as it requires PXE which in turn requires inspector to "manage" the boot for the node (esp. to update the DHCP filtering to avoid collisions with normal boot).

This needs to be mentioned in the spec.

Cheers,
milan'}, {'account_id': 11297, 'date': '2017-04-26 10:32:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 13:

Hi Milan,

Thanks.
But i dont understand this.
"Other thing is discovery is mutually-exclusive with this manage boot feature as it requires PXE which in turn requires inspector to "manage" the boot for the node (esp. to update the DHCP filtering to avoid collisions with normal boot)." Could you elaborate?'}, {'account_id': 18653, 'date': '2017-04-26 10:43:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 13:

Hi,

> But i dont understand this. "Other thing is discovery is mutually-exclusive with this manage boot feature as it requires PXE which in turn requires inspector to "manage" the boot for the node (esp. to update the DHCP filtering to avoid collisions with normal boot)." Could you elaborate?

Node discovery is a feature where your brand new node, having been plugged into the rack and powered on the first time, will be recognized and "configured" by inspector (node_not_found_hook). This inspector feature assumes PXE boot environment.

Cheers,
milan'}, {'account_id': 11297, 'date': '2017-04-26 10:47:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 13:

"esp. to update the DHCP filtering to avoid collisions with normal boot" --
 Why DHCP collision can occur?'}, {'account_id': 11297, 'date': '2017-04-27 04:58:35.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 14.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2017-04-27 05:02:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 14: Verified+1

Cheers,
milan

commit_message:
Calculate the requires list in check_resource

Obtain the list of required resources in one place in check_resource,
instead of in both Resource.create_convergence() and
Resource.update_convergence(). Since these require knowledge about how the
dependencies are encoded in the RPC message, they never really belonged in
the Resource class anyway.

Change-Id: I030c6287acddcd91dfe5fecba72c276fec52829b

commit_message:
Drop py34 and py33 target in tox.ini

We support py35 now.so it is no need to keep
the supoort for py34 and py33.

Change-Id: I7e09988f7b08fe978383029619da0a82cbfa4203

commit_message:
Enable ui & logviewer locally

Commit enables storm-{logviewer,ui} for the purposes
of the local development but keeps them disabled
in the gate runs.

Depends-On: Iccc30d411a49b9e47d6625909427f071397aedfd
Change-Id: I8cc2d6c616eff9ab058b24f837c655228b84f184

I think you should modify those files at least. neutron_lbaas/extensions/loadbalancerv2.py
neutron_lbaas/services/loadbalancer/data_models.py'}, {'account_id': 13438, 'date': '2018-01-04 08:45:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

@Dongcan Ye
As long as NLbaaS is not deprecated, no reason not to have this. As of now most of the LB vendors do not have Octavia support.'}, {'account_id': 12860, 'date': '2018-01-04 13:18:15.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: -Code-Review

@Kobi Samoray, I'm ok with this change, let us listen to Michael Johnson and other cores."}, {'account_id': 11628, 'date': '2018-04-11 21:11:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-2

neutron-lbaas is deprecated and replaced by Octavia.
Due to the deprecation neutron-lbaas is under feature freeze and not accepting new feature patches. For more information on the deprecation, please see: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Neutron/LBaaS/Deprecation

If this feature is important for load balancing in OpenStack, please propose it on the Octaiva project.'}, {'account_id': 13438, 'date': '2018-05-14 12:53:33.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]

commit_message:
Database models timestamps

Timestamp mixin has been standard addition to neutron tables for a while.
This patch adds these columns to neutron_lbaas DB objects.

Change-Id: Ic71647f688ecc85347e79fc0e80f465252ae4859

commit_message:
Support filter search for share type API

Since manila server allows filter search extra_specs and is_public,
so it's better to add this in manila client as well.

Change-Id: Ie85a7c09d4d7c6ddc31adb5125feea265ad8fced
Depends-On: Id577ae9d08dc0fae3dcac78d98ec0456f8378417
Partially-Implements: blueprint support-filter-search-for-share-type

subject: Disable mlock when running in containers
messages: [{'account_id': 935, 'date': '2018-05-14 08:41:25.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 12549, 'date': '2018-05-14 12:32:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1\n\nLGTM, nice fix.'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-05-14 08:41:25.000000000', 'message': 'Disable mlock when running in containers

Its not possible to use mlock when running vault inside a
container; automatically disable vault mlock when this is
detected.

mlock status is now always reflected in juju status output
for full transparency.

Change-Id: I57cf1d19e2783ec41e2d37cb4300a55828212cc3
'}]
commit_message:
Disable mlock when running in containers

Its not possible to use mlock when running vault inside a
container; automatically disable vault mlock when this is
detected.

mlock status is now always reflected in juju status output
for full transparency.

Change-Id: I57cf1d19e2783ec41e2d37cb4300a55828212cc3

commit_message:
rpm-distro: set the contentdir yum var

Since CentOS-7.5, a new yum variable is needed for SIG repositories.
This change replicates the %post task of the centos-release package
to setup the contentdir yum var. This should fix issues when
repository url uses $contentdir and yum fail with:
http://mirror.centos.org/%24contentdir ... [Errno 14] HTTP Error 404 - Not Found

For more details see:

https://lists.centos.org/pipermail/centos-devel/2018-March/016542.html

This change also drops support for fedora without dnf.

Change-Id: I1819a48b94670577b0c5e29b24cebfb20ea07d28

commit_message:
ESFIX:Let cluster-instance show more instance

Currently,can only display the member node when using
cluster-instances for the mongodb cluster, and now increase the
display of the query_router and configsvr nodes

Change-Id: I122215e021773ac359a7fbf0b589e6277b952131
Partial-Bug: #1697394

[{'created': '2018-05-11 22:06:38.000000000', 'message': "Fix tenant DeprecationWarning from oslo_context

Unit tests run a bit slow because all context invocations
were resulting in a deprecation warning being logged for
each task invocation.

Seems like it was an easy change!

Error:

DeprecationWarning: Using the 'tenant' argument is deprecated
in version '2.18' and will be removed in version '3.0',
please use the 'project_id' argument instead

Change-Id: Ie555a5c554356c04d929fce972b061f720701355
"}]
commit_message:
Fix tenant DeprecationWarning from oslo_context

Unit tests run a bit slow because all context invocations
were resulting in a deprecation warning being logged for
each task invocation.

Seems like it was an easy change!

Error:

DeprecationWarning: Using the 'tenant' argument is deprecated
in version '2.18' and will be removed in version '3.0',
please use the 'project_id' argument instead

Change-Id: Ie555a5c554356c04d929fce972b061f720701355

commit_message:
Allow configuration of NFS backend for Nova

Allow NFS configuration of storage backend for Nova.
This way the instances files will be stored on a shared
NFS storage.

Implements: bp tripleo-nova-nfs

Change-Id: I994d75e3d85af7714e9fe3c8dba4d19e3dc257a5

commit_message:
Convert CLI options to variables for updates/upgrades/ffwd.

Some cli options like --ntp-server/--control-scaler have variables
e.g.: NtpServer or RoleFlavor/Count.
It makes sense to convert them to env file and use it in follow up
 update/upgrade/ffwd operations, rather then maintain a list of cli
options.

Change-Id: Ie1305b8783de403fe0c725b1207782dd8336c053

commit_message:
Add option to enable admin API and quotas

This patchset adds an option which can be used to enable an
experimental admin API for Designate and quota extension for it.

Change-Id: I3c1da2a53e52a50b19a569d16e995d5e20ed3f4d
Closes-Bug: 1755451

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-05-10 16:21:58.000000000', 'message': "Add yum update to base

In order to handle out of date distro containers, let's add a yum update
to the kolla base container to ensure that at the end of the base
container build we'll have the latest base packages installed. This will
ensure we don't hit out of date dependency bits in later containers. For
example, we currently only have 7.4 base centos image available from the
upstream but we're install the base repos in the base build. This would
mean that we'd be getting 7.5 packages in later containers but might
possibly have a mix of 7.4 and 7.5 packages installed.

Change-Id: Ifdfc1b84b7b6a306868260611271fd49bdd594d4
Related-Bug: #1770355
"}]
commit_message:
Add yum update to base

In order to handle out of date distro containers, let's add a yum update
to the kolla base container to ensure that at the end of the base
container build we'll have the latest base packages installed. This will
ensure we don't hit out of date dependency bits in later containers. For
example, we currently only have 7.4 base centos image available from the
upstream but we're install the base repos in the base build. This would
mean that we'd be getting 7.5 packages in later containers but might
possibly have a mix of 7.4 and 7.5 packages installed.

Change-Id: Ifdfc1b84b7b6a306868260611271fd49bdd594d4
Related-Bug: #1770355

commit_message:
Remove centos-release-qemu-ev release packages

When removing not needed repos remove also centos-release-qemu-ev
as it's not needed. We have qemu-ev repo in mirrors.

Change-Id: I9e47f40e76937295df6f628f5fff6a3128b085ea
Close-Bug: #1770947

Create INI file ConfigurationSourceDriver.The configuration source driver looks for an URI to setup the INIConfigurationSource.The INIConfigurationSource class was created as a placeholder for now.The allowed shemes so far are 'http' and 'https', we can add 'file' to also supportopening files from a path like: "file:///etc/foo/bar.conf"Change-Id: I2e220346b2e3a0ea2171e28d785bf06f0abeb12bSigned-off-by: Moises Guimaraes de Medeiros <moguimar@redhat.com>

Change-Id: If31b3f95da6e64ea660562f0455c504a8b569024

uses the HTTP management API to check for the presence of cluster

Change-Id: Ib7eb1afe258931cc917c151a2b6d72dc56d30c95
Closes-Bug: #1548679
'}, {'created': '2017-11-14 09:35:47.000000000', 'message': "Add Nagios check for cluster partitions

This commit introduces the check_rabbitmq_cluster.py Nagios check, which
uses the HTTP management API to check for the presence of cluster
partitions. The check will only be installed if the management_plugin
charm configuration is set to True, enabling the HTTP API plugin.

As a special note for review - this requires that the monitoring use be
granted access to be able to query cluster state, which is an
administrative privilege. As a result, the charm hooks will configure
the nagios monitoring RabbitMQ users created for each units to now have
the 'admin' privilege. I am open to alternative approaches.

Change-Id: Ib7eb1afe258931cc917c151a2b6d72dc56d30c95
Closes-Bug: #1548679
"}, {'created': '2017-11-15 12:26:13.000000000', 'message': "Add Nagios check for cluster partitions

This commit introduces the check_rabbitmq_cluster.py Nagios check, which
uses the HTTP management API to check for the presence of cluster
partitions. The check will only be installed if the management_plugin
charm configuration is set to True, enabling the HTTP API plugin.

As a special note for review - this requires that the monitoring use be
granted access to be able to query cluster state, which is an
administrative privilege. As a result, the charm hooks will configure
the nagios monitoring RabbitMQ users created for each units to now have
the 'admin' privilege. I am open to alternative approaches.

Also cleans up usage of os.getenv('CHARM_DIR') in several places in the
file hooks/rabbitmq_server_relations.py

Change-Id: Ib7eb1afe258931cc917c151a2b6d72dc56d30c95
Closes-Bug: #1548679
"}, {'created': '2017-12-04 06:24:26.000000000', 'message': "Add Nagios check for cluster partitions

This commit introduces the check_rabbitmq_cluster.py Nagios check, which
uses the HTTP management API to check for the presence of cluster
partitions. The check will only be installed if the management_plugin
charm configuration is set to True, enabling the HTTP API plugin.

The previous request to use administrator privileges to monitor cluster
health is no longer required. The create_user and user_exists logic has
been reworked to accomodate different tags, and the monitoring tag,
which is respected by the HTTP management API used to monitor cluster
health, has been used instead of the administrator privilege.

Also cleans up usage of os.getenv('CHARM_DIR') in several places in the
file hooks/rabbitmq_server_relations.py

Change-Id: Ib7eb1afe258931cc917c151a2b6d72dc56d30c95
Closes-Bug: #1548679
"}, {'created': '2018-02-20 23:30:52.000000000', 'message': "Add Nagios check for cluster partitions

uses the HTTP management API to check for the presence of cluster
partitions. The check will only be installed if the management_plugin
charm configuration is set to True, enabling the HTTP API plugin.

The previous request to use administrator privileges to monitor cluster
health is no longer required. The create_user and user_exists logic has
been reworked to accomodate different tags, and the monitoring tag,
which is respected by the HTTP management API used to monitor cluster
health, has been used instead of the administrator privilege.

Also cleans up usage of os.getenv('CHARM_DIR') in several places in the
file hooks/rabbitmq_server_relations.py

commit_message:
Add Nagios check for cluster partitions

This commit introduces the check_rabbitmq_cluster.py Nagios check, which
uses the HTTP management API to check for the presence of cluster
partitions. The check will only be installed if the management_plugin
charm configuration is set to True, enabling the HTTP API plugin.

The previous request to use administrator privileges to monitor cluster
health is no longer required. The create_user and user_exists logic has
been reworked to accomodate different tags, and the monitoring tag,
which is respected by the HTTP management API used to monitor cluster
health, has been used instead of the administrator privilege.

Also cleans up usage of os.getenv('CHARM_DIR') in several places in the
file hooks/rabbitmq_server_relations.py

Change-Id: Ib7eb1afe258931cc917c151a2b6d72dc56d30c95
Closes-Bug: #1548679

Instead of needlessly overloading ContainerBroker.merge_items to
handle either objects or shard ranges, send a different verb with
the REPLICATE request when replicating shard ranges.

Also eliminate get_other_replication_items() from DatabaseBroker by
providing a hook in rsync_then_merge.

Change-Id: Ib22d33639ecf6c18ecb1730eec687c9198127cb6
'}]
commit_message:
SQUASH: Use separate replication verb for sending shard ranges

Instead of needlessly overloading ContainerBroker.merge_items to
handle either objects or shard ranges, send a different verb with
the REPLICATE request when replicating shard ranges.

Also eliminate get_other_replication_items() from DatabaseBroker by
providing a hook in rsync_then_merge.

Change-Id: Ib22d33639ecf6c18ecb1730eec687c9198127cb6

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-05-10 13:49:24.000000000', 'message': "Improve DbListCommand operation from O(n^2) to O(n)

Right now the DbListCommand retrieves the uuid's of all the elements
passed in as argument. This is an O(n^2) operation so when the number
of elements in a grows it's likely that we get Timeout Exceptions.

Instead of doing this, whenever possible, we'll retrieve all the
elements (from the in-memory replica) and only fetch those who were
passed as arguments avoiding the O(n^2) operation.

Change-Id: I71411e5dd68753eb3825f8b0e91009f87de1b260
Closes-Bug: #1769897
"}, {'created': '2018-05-10 13:50:09.000000000', 'message': "Improve DbListCommand operation from O(n^2) to O(n)

Right now the DbListCommand retrieves the uuid's of all the elements
passed in as argument. This is an O(n^2) operation so when the number
of elements in a grows it's likely that we get Timeout Exceptions.

Instead of doing this, whenever possible, we'll retrieve all the
elements (from the in-memory replica) and only fetch those who were
passed as arguments avoiding the O(n^2) operation.

(cherry picked from 476b174f7d303c501fa2f3b91efda659ed9b9f3d)
Change-Id: I71411e5dd68753eb3825f8b0e91009f87de1b260
Closes-Bug: #1769897
"}]
commit_message:
Improve DbListCommand operation from O(n^2) to O(n)

Right now the DbListCommand retrieves the uuid's of all the elements
passed in as argument. This is an O(n^2) operation so when the number
of elements in a grows it's likely that we get Timeout Exceptions.

Instead of doing this, whenever possible, we'll retrieve all the
elements (from the in-memory replica) and only fetch those who were
passed as arguments avoiding the O(n^2) operation.

(cherry picked from 476b174f7d303c501fa2f3b91efda659ed9b9f3d)
Change-Id: I71411e5dd68753eb3825f8b0e91009f87de1b260
Closes-Bug: #1769897

subject: Skip building kernel modules for CentOS when compiling OVS
messages:
[{'account_id': 6773, 'date': '2018-05-11 12:23:19.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6773, 'date': '2018-05-11 13:20:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

recheck

zuul was dead'}, {'account_id': 8871, 'date': '2018-05-11 15:34:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I noticed Zuul failed, I think you hit bug(s):

- networking-ovn-tempest-dsvm-ovs-release-centos7: unrecognized error
- tripleo-ci-centos-7-scenario007-multinode-oooq-container: https://bugs.launchpad.net/bugs/1708704

Some of the tests failed in a way that we did not understand. Please help us classify these issues so that they can be part of Elastic Recheck http://status.openstack.org/elastic-recheck/
For more details on this and other bugs, please see http://status.openstack.org/elastic-recheck/'}, {'account_id': 6773, 'date': '2018-05-14 08:56:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 6773, 'date': '2018-05-14 10:33:38.000000000', 'content': "Abandoned

Doesn't work"}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-05-11 12:23:19.000000000', 'message': "Skip building kernel modules for CentOS when compiling OVS

Due to a incompatible change on RHEL 7.5 kernel related to the
ndo_change_mtu function pointer, building the modules for RHEL 7.5 and
CentOS 7 1804 is broken. There's already an OVS patch for this at
https://patchwork.ozlabs.org/patch/911232/

While this patch is not merged in OVS and backported to branch 2.9,
let's skip building the kernel modules for the CentOS job so we can
unblock the networking-ovn's gate.

Change-Id: I75dacf4683aafe58c5f753ddd7c3dcf28c87ddd4
"}]
commit_message:
Skip building kernel modules for CentOS when compiling OVS

Due to a incompatible change on RHEL 7.5 kernel related to the
ndo_change_mtu function pointer, building the modules for RHEL 7.5 and
CentOS 7 1804 is broken. There's already an OVS patch for this at
https://patchwork.ozlabs.org/patch/911232/

While this patch is not merged in OVS and backported to branch 2.9,
let's skip building the kernel modules for the CentOS job so we can
unblock the networking-ovn's gate.

Change-Id: I75dacf4683aafe58c5f753ddd7c3dcf28c87ddd4

agreed upon at the Ocata design summit, concerning the use-at-your-

commit_message:
Zuul: Remove project name

Zuul no longer requires the project-name for in-repo configuration.
Omitting it makes forking or renaming projects easier.

Change-Id: Ic78f022db933dc89c2367187535695ac7f30bcca

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-05-14 06:57:51.000000000', 'message': 'Remove distro package indexing for Ansible 2.0+

The indexing of distro packages by the py_pkgs lookup was
intended for a purpose which never came to fruition. As
such it is not used. The resulting output is somewhat
confusing and very verbose. As such, we removed it
in upper branches. This can be removed in Ocata too.

A backport removed this feature for Ansible 1.x but not
Ansible 2.x.

Change-Id: I6ce00c18751055e91b36e5530565726fa030c47f
'}]
commit_message:
Remove distro package indexing for Ansible 2.0+

The indexing of distro packages by the py_pkgs lookup was
intended for a purpose which never came to fruition. As
such it is not used. The resulting output is somewhat
confusing and very verbose. As such, we removed it
in upper branches. This can be removed in Ocata too.

A backport removed this feature for Ansible 1.x but not
Ansible 2.x.

Change-Id: I6ce00c18751055e91b36e5530565726fa030c47f

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-20 20:47:55.000000000', 'message': "remove description API attr from secgroup and segment

This patch removes the explicit API definition of the 'description'
attribute from the segment and security group API extensions. These
attributes are redundant as they are added by default by the
standardattrdescription extension and moreover are clobbered by the
latter.

In addition this patch updates the UTs to account for the extension
manager not adding the standardattrdescription to the security group
and segment definitions during test runtime. Finally one segment
test is updated as description cannot be set to None/null via
standardattrdescription.

Note that the segment API definition is already in neutron-lib, but not
yet consumed. This patch proposes we remove description from segment in
neutron first, and then we can do such in lib before consuming.

Change-Id: I1fcc2adf13792705fc4bb6faf757ee59faee1349
Partial-Bug: 1757513
"}, {'created': '2018-04-20 20:49:06.000000000', 'message': "remove description API attr from secgroup and segment

and segment definitions during test runtime. Finally one segment

Note that the segment API definition is already in neutron-lib, but not
yet consumed. This patch proposes we remove description from segment in

Change-Id: I1fcc2adf13792705fc4bb6faf757ee59faee1349
Partial-Bug: 1757513
"}, {'created': '2018-04-24 21:53:07.000000000', 'message': 'remove description API attr from secgroup and segment

This patch removes the explicit API definition of the 'description'
attribute from the segment and security group API extensions. These
attributes are redundant as they are added by default by the
standardattrdescription extension and moreover are clobbered by the
latter.

In addition this patch updates the UTs to account for the extension
manager not adding the standardattrdescription to the security group
and segment definitions during test runtime. Finally one segment
test is updated as description cannot be set to None/null via
standardattrdescription.

Note that the segment API definition is already in neutron-lib, but not
yet consumed. This patch proposes we remove description from segment in
neutron first, and then we can do such in lib before consuming.

Also note that consumers must now account for "priming" the description
attribute in their UTs. For example [1]. However consumers can be
updated (like [1]) before-hand allowing this change to not impact them.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/564071

Change-Id: I1fcc2adf13792705fc4bb6faf757ee59faee1349
Partial-Bug: 1757513
'}, {'created': '2018-05-03 17:23:08.000000000', 'message': "remove description API attr from securitygroup

This patch removes the explicit API definition of the 'description'
attribute from the security group API extension. This
attributes is redundant as its added by default by the
standardattrdescription extension and moreover are clobbered by the
latter.

In addition this patch updates the UTs to account for the extension
manager not adding the standardattrdescription to the security group
definition during test runtime.

Also note that the segment API extension has the same issue, but will be
handled with the consumption of https://review.openstack.org/#/c/562331/

Change-Id: I1fcc2adf13792705fc4bb6faf757ee59faee1349

commit_message:
remove description API attr from securitygroup

This patch removes the explicit API definition of the 'description'
attribute from the security group API extension. This
attributes is redundant as its added by default by the
standardattrdescription extension and moreover are clobbered by the
latter.

In addition this patch updates the UTs to account for the extension
manager not adding the standardattrdescription to the security group
definition during test runtime.

Also note that the segment API extension has the same issue, but will be
handled with the consumption of https://review.openstack.org/#/c/562331/

Change-Id: I1fcc2adf13792705fc4bb6faf757ee59faee1349
Partial-Bug: 1757513

commit_message:
libvirt: rework _get_vpcu_total to return online pCPUs

Previously if CONF.vcpu_pin_set were not configured we would just
return the total amount pCPUs without to take care of whether some of
them are offline.
In this rework we try to do besteffort by returning only online pCPUs
whether or not CONF.vcpu_pin_set is configured.

Change-Id: I0f96c57446eeae0826f9e0ef1a5c7cc6b1b3def5
Signed-off-by: Sahid Orentino Ferdjaoui <sahid.ferdjaoui@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Fix ip_conntrack_proto_sctp modprobe error

tools/configure_for_func_testing.sh tries to load the
ip_conntrack_proto_sctp module unconditionally, even if
it doesn't exist.  Detect and only load if necessary.

Trivialfix

Change-Id: Idff8c9402d8ffcb21ae4f561642f65aeebbe8067

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-05-08 16:13:14.000000000', 'message': "Change defaults in tools/configure_for_func_testing.sh

The defaults in tools/configure_for_func_testing.sh don't
match what devstack uses, so running it while a stack is
running breaks all database access.  Changing the defaults
should be less destructive.

Also change the Postgres default to False since it's not
a typical choice either, and can cause package installation
issues when it's not available, even if it isn't needed.

Change-Id: I2d2a7ef034f670f3927ecc7b7706876872a01c77

commit_message:
Change defaults in tools/configure_for_func_testing.sh

The defaults in tools/configure_for_func_testing.sh don't
match what devstack uses, so running it while a stack is
running breaks all database access.  Change to source
local.conf if it exists, else use the devstack defaults
to be less destructive.

Change-Id: I2d2a7ef034f670f3927ecc7b7706876872a01c77

commit_message:
base: set $contentdir for CentOS

CentOS recently started syncing alternate arch repos to mirrors. And to
make it easier to play with centos-* packages idea of 'contentdir'
appeared.

https://lists.centos.org/pipermail/centos-devel/2018-March/016542.html

Change-Id: Ieb26c0aa65ba3ec1a45a33f87f670e5ecb782f82

commit_message:
Add pip cache cleanup to pip-and-virtualenv

The pip-and-virtualenv element provides pip inside the created images.
When this pip is used inside the chroot of the image it, by default, creates
a cache directory with the http packages and the resulting wheels.
In the case of the octavia ubuntu-minimal image this cache is using ~50MB of
cache that is not needed after the image finished building.

This package creates a finalise.d task that removes the cache from the
default location.

Change-Id: I4715437b068d04993ef755bd1e27963db1d22417

commit_message:
Fixes add-apt-keys in dpkg element

This commit addresses the issue described in bug 1768354 when using the
apt-sources element and adding a key to a custom repo, subsequent deb
package installs fail due no update of the repo before package install

Change-Id: I968b3422fab2fb2305426d49215391d8ba7499df
Closes-Bug: 1768354

commit_message:
Update install doc for ubuntu

This change updates the auth_url value to match
what has changed in the keystone install guide:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/541857/

According to LipingMao's comment, replace port 35357 with 5000 in README.rst

Change-Id: I70c7181e391e7192de7b94d6f58c05a705368163

Note, I'm not going to fix that for deprecated instack.
If you think we should not relax the check allowing non FQDN hostnames, please update https://bugs.launchpad.net/tripleo/+bug/1737356 as won't fix. Thanks!"}, {'account_id': 8871, 'date': '2018-05-10 12:09:54.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I noticed Zuul failed, I think you hit bug(s):

- tripleo-ci-centos-7-containers-multinode: https://bugs.launchpad.net/bugs/1686542
- tripleo-ci-centos-7-scenario000-multinode-oooq-container-updates: https://bugs.launchpad.net/bugs/1686542

If you believe we've correctly identified the failure, feel free to leave a 'recheck' comment to run the tests again.
For more details on this and other bugs, please see http://status.openstack.org/elastic-recheck/"}, {'account_id': 7144, 'date': '2018-05-10 15:16:35.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

what is the technical reason why can't we require a fqdn? 

where it's not set, it has caused issues in the past.

I don't see any compelling reason to drop the check other than that the check is doing what it's supposed to do and blocked an installation where a fqdn is not set.

The fix them to me sounds like to set one, not drop the check."}, {'account_id': 6926, 'date': '2018-05-14 08:23:43.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]

commit_message:
Move set_vf_interface_vlan to the new utility module.

Continued moving of methods which aren't unique to nova-net out of
linux_net.

Change-Id: Ie3a7155d4d27f5d856755e385e012d9b5bf3d061
blueprint: remove-nova-network

commit_message:
Add random sleep between retry calls to placement

Attempt to reduce the resource provider contention by adding a random
sleep between retry calls to placement.

Change-Id: I4b7217f652dc2f5ff59f9d6a0178fa8f9325f706
Closes-Bug: #1770220

commit_message:
Fix tox jobs and remove tox_helper.sh

Horizon plugins needs horizon on master branch for our
master development and test.

Recent changes in CI infra and horizon force to change horizon
installation, and added tox_helper.sh as trivial fix.

Now, reasonable fix found for horizon plugins,
so this patch fixes them.

Also, use python3.5 for js jobs.

Change-Id: Ibcaf177db21f96e60ee2b222ddd24bc61c3ee9e4

commit_message:
Fix tox jobs and remove tox_helper.sh

Horizon plugins needs horizon on master branch for our
master development and test.

Recent changes in CI infra and horizon force to change horizon
installation, and added tox_helper.sh as trivial fix.

Now, reasonable fix found for horizon plugins,
so this patch fixes them.

Change-Id: Ieae9bfdfed113795c0a7065964781914a2d041ce
Depends-On: I506e9c761ad1af3126db2c4778aa9dbbcf340130

Follow the new PTI for document build

For compliance with the Project Testing Interface as described in:

https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/project-testing-interface.html

For more details information, please refer to:

http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-December/125710.html

Change-Id: I8f3f9f1ae087b0abd5db0b0f58e83870ca49a529

commit_message:
Fix incorrect splitting of dimension in ProxyView

Fix problem with incorrect splitting of dimension when
dimension value contains a colon.
This change is based on
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/518017/

Story: 2001998
Task: 19632
Change-Id: I71801c35072136df88898c57b765c12c5086c6b3
(cherry picked from commit 7b606516e736986c1a03365c06575537cbcfffe7)

Add exclude-path to undercloud backups

This patch adds the option to exclude files
when executing an Undercloud backup

Change-Id: If8902980c93212401e5ff30828f6f03da6eece0e
Closes-Bug: 1767385

charms: Add the neutron dynamic routing projects

This change is part of the change set to add the neutron dynamic
routing charm and associated reactive bgp interface as new
projects.

commit_message:
Require the (soon-to-be) Rocky version of Horizon

... or at least the first published tarball which will lead to Rocky.
On the other side this means forcing the usage of mox as long as
there are tests that depends on it (the switch was already flipped
in Horizon, so it needs to be enabled here).

This allows us to depend on newer Horizon features, including changes
to the test suite that are useful for the mox removal effort.

Change-Id: Icb2225b70905bd9e83f45e367747e75877863386
Signed-off-by: Charles Short <zulcss@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Fix to reuse RabbitMQ connection

Currently RabbitMQ connection gradually increases by CONTINUOUS audit
with auto-trigger option.
This patch fixes watcher to reuse RabbitMQ connection.

Change-Id: I818fc1ce982f67bac08c815821f1ad67f8f3c893

Change-Id: Iec4f266324d4e5f81d21163f68f8d5c32c34f86d

modules to interact with the running OpenStack environment
in tests, we execute the openstack_openrc role against
the test host.

The include_vars for the follow-on play is moved to make
it easier to find, and the initial play's 'pre_tasks' are

"}]
commit_message:
Implement clouds.yaml on test hosts

In order to allow us to make use of the Ansible shade
modules to interact with the running OpenStack environment
in tests, we execute the openstack_openrc role against
the test host.

The include_vars for the follow-on play is moved to make
it easier to find, and the initial play's 'pre_tasks' are
renamed to 'tasks' as there is no 'roles' implementation
in the play.

Change-Id: Iec4f266324d4e5f81d21163f68f8d5c32c34f86d

commit_message:
Refactor functions out of ProcessTemplateAction

This needs to be common utility code for the next change in this
series, and breaking them out allows the test coverage to be improved.

Change-Id: I9d55ccfbd2875046dc7512413c3be3254a45910a
Blueprint: container-prepare-workflow

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-07-22 01:35:04.000000000', 'message': "Don't pass input_data to Resource.delete_convergence()

In the original prototype for convergence, we passed the input_data from
the SyncPoint to the resource when calling the equivalent of
convergence_delete(), so that we could clear and needed_by references that
no longer exist. This is pointless for a few reasons:

* It's implemented incorrectly - it *sets* the referenced resources into
  needed_by instead of clearing them from it.
* We don't actually pass any input data - in WorkerService.check_resource()
  it's always set to an empty dict for cleanup nodes, regardless of what
  came in on the wire.
* We don't store the result to the database unless we're deleting the
  resource anyway - in which case it doesn't matter.
* It turns out that even in the prototype, the whole needed_by mechanism
  isn't actually used for anything:
  https://github.com/zaneb/heat-convergence-prototype/commit/c74aac1f07e3fdf1fe382a7edce6c4828eda13e3

Rather than pretend that we're doing something useful with the input_data
here, just set the needed_by to an empty list, which is what was happening
anyway.

Change-Id: I73f6cf1646584dc4a83497f5a583c2c8973e8aba

commit_message:
Don't pass input_data to Resource.delete_convergence()

In the original prototype for convergence, we passed the input_data from
the SyncPoint to the resource when calling the equivalent of
convergence_delete(), so that we could clear and needed_by references that
no longer exist. This is pointless for a few reasons:

* It's implemented incorrectly - it *sets* the referenced resources into
  needed_by instead of clearing them from it.
* We don't actually pass any input data - in WorkerService.check_resource()
  it's always set to an empty dict for cleanup nodes, regardless of what
  came in on the wire.
* We don't store the result to the database unless we're deleting the
  resource anyway - in which case it doesn't matter.
* It turns out that even in the prototype, the whole needed_by mechanism
  isn't actually used for anything:
  https://github.com/zaneb/heat-convergence-prototype/commit/c74aac1f07e3fdf1fe382a7edce6c4828eda13e3

Rather than pretend that we're doing something useful with the input_data
here, just set the needed_by to an empty list, which is what was happening
anyway.

Change-Id: I73f6cf1646584dc4a83497f5a583c2c8973e8aba

commit_message:
Add service params to keep systems in sync

While the start order of these services shouldn't have any conflicts
this change ensures it by forcing the various services to be part of one
another and have specific ordering.

Change-Id: Idf5de7d018a92d6df31b3277e46473698088bfd8
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
Add connection_parameters to list of items copied from database

oslo.db includes additional essential options that are
at the moment hardcoded in Nova's api_database conf.
Here, we add connection_parameters, which itself was added
to oslo.db to work around Nova's database-persisted
database URLs being difficult to modify.

This change should have been included in
I22f8a19009408fb1f1587bf399e6aee3467c8bc6 as this is part of
allowing nova to support SQLAlchemy extensions including
profiling.

Change-Id: I249aeabb5f029a2c4648651cf1e7b9b2e552e395

commit_message:
ceph: run 2 mds replicas

take replica count from values, default to 2; ideally we want 2 mds
replicas, 1 active and 1 standby

Change-Id: Ifd9e717ad0371e52ce26e0da3393f5f634495f58

commit_message:
Convert identity.groups tests into mock

In addition, domain_get() call checks previously succeeded somehow
with mox test, but they now fails after mock migration.
api.keystone.get_effective_domain_id() is now mocked instead of
api.keystone.domain_get(). There is no need to test the internal of
api.keystone, so get_effective_domain_id() is the right place to mock.

blueprint mock-framework-in-unit-tests
Change-Id: I567168a8001875efb3e768aa732ceb562b1dd99f

commit_message:
libvirt: always pass emulator threads policy

It's necessary to pass the policy since in the following change we
will handle the special case with SHARE and CONF.cpu_shared_set
configured.

Change-Id: Icab6a16993e2d3a69ab60fd512981bc65d7f6eb3
Signed-off-by: Sahid Orentino Ferdjaoui <sahid.ferdjaoui@redhat.com>
Partial-implement: bp/overhead-pin-set

commit_message:
Fix list and show return status different

This patch fix when container exist error in docker
inspect, zun will configure the status in 'Error'.

Change-Id: I54f2a42e6fca41b35624058fc3774ab4a40008ed
Closes-Bug: #1769798

The call of self.list_networks is a shortcut of
self.neutron.list_networks because this class override the
__getattr__ method which will invoke unknown method from self.neutron.
This patch switches to the shortcut version to follow the code
convention to reduce confusion of our contributors.

Change-Id: I05b003d0e7d993873d8690694ddc41f07ecbf7d8
Signed-off-by: Yuanbin.Chen <cybing4@gmail.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Change neutron module use same call neutron client

The call of self.list_networks is a shortcut of
self.neutron.list_networks because this class override the
__getattr__ method which will invoke unknown method from self.neutron.
This patch switches to the shortcut version to follow the code
convention to reduce confusion of our contributors.

Change-Id: I05b003d0e7d993873d8690694ddc41f07ecbf7d8
Signed-off-by: Yuanbin.Chen <cybing4@gmail.com>

[{'created': '2018-04-23 14:00:51.000000000', 'message': "Align UC net/env-files override with instack

...and tripleoclient.

When installing via 'undercloud deploy', add
environments/docker.yaml explicitly, as the client
does for undercloud install --use-heat.

Use undercloud_custom_env_files instead of
undercloud_extra_services_args.

Allow to override undercloud net config via a
custom file defined from undercloud_net_config_override.
Defaults generated from undercloud_resource_registry_args
and undercloud_network_environment_args.

This provides a single interface for passing in custom tht
env files and maintains feature parity of containerized UC heat
installer with instack/undercloud.conf.

Closes-bug: #1763337

Depends-on: I3b59abc839ec6c709e5fd24652610a5fac58ee57
Change-Id: Iaeca9ea014d99147461c6e3fae3122e27cb88c1d

commit_message:
Align UC net/env-files override with instack

...and tripleoclient.

When installing via 'undercloud deploy', add
environments/docker.yaml explicitly, as the client
does for undercloud install --use-heat.

Use undercloud_custom_env_files instead of
undercloud_extra_services_args.

Allow to override undercloud net config via a
custom file defined from undercloud_net_config_override.

Default t-h-t params file for net config are generated from
undercloud_resource_registry_args and
undercloud_network_environment_args and can be overriden via
undercloud_net_config_override and/or undercloud_custom_env_files.

This maintains feature parity of containerized UC heat
installer with instack/undercloud.conf.

Closes-bug: #1763337

Depends-on: I3b59abc839ec6c709e5fd24652610a5fac58ee57
Change-Id: Iaeca9ea014d99147461c6e3fae3122e27cb88c1d
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-08-24 11:09:41.000000000', 'message': 'XenAPI: image handler option improvement

This commit's purpose is to:
1. deprecate the option of image_upload_handler which need to be
configured with a class path string.
2. make the image download method to be configurable and use the
same image handler for download and upload.

So it contains the following changes:
1. deprecate the option of "image_upload_handler".
2. added a new option of "image_handler" which will be used to
choose a short name for the supported image handler plugins.
3. As VdiThroughDevStore currently has implementation for image
upload, add implementation to invoke the default plugin's image
download function, so that it will preserves the existing behavior.

Change-Id: I37860e63de32d988525cdc32440fe711777263e6
Blueprint: xenapi-image-handler-option-improvement
'}, {'created': '2017-08-29 10:17:20.000000000', 'message': 'XenAPI: deprecate image handler class path option

choose a short name for the supported image handler plugins.
3. As VdiThroughDevStore has only implemented the method fo
image upload, let's implement the image download method by invoking
the glance.GlanceStore.download_image(), so that it will preserves
the existing behavior.

commit_message:
XenAPI: deprecate the config for image handler class path

This commit is to deprecate the config of image_upload_handler
which need to be configured with a class path string. And we
should make download handler be configurable to be consistent
with the upload handler.

So it contains the following changes:
1. deprecate the option of "image_upload_handler".
2. added a new option of "image_handler" which will be used to
choose a short name from the supported image handler plugins.
The proper handler will be loaded at runtime basing on the
option setting.

TODO(jianghuaw): For the legacy handler of VdiThroughDevStore
which has no download function implemented. For downloading, it
is handled in a different way (call xenapi.vm_utils._stream_disk()).
We keep it as it is now. In the future, we should consider to
move _stream_disk to VdiThroughDevStore's download().

Change-Id: I37860e63de32d988525cdc32440fe711777263e6
Blueprint: xenapi-image-handler-option-improvement

commit_message:
3PAR: Update CHAP on host record when volume is migrated to new compute host

When the nova instances are migrated from one compute host to another,
during the new VLUN creation step, the host record created on 3PAR has
the old chap credentials, but the volume metadata contains the newly
generated CHAP credentials. This fix will ensure the CHAP authentication
credentials on volume metadata and the host record on 3PAR are in sync
when the nova instances are live migrated.

Closes-Bug: #1737181

Change-Id: I2d4b7530b2d249ca193f7d0e87d529c9eb2dc25d
(cherry picked from commit bfc8c849df043d7695c70a5e90e5b95e93ce0728)

commit_message:
Support packages list for updates in container

Use -k|--packages to set exactly which packages we want to update.
By default it's None and all packages will be updated.

Change-Id: Ic6453724cda79f294c25bcebb3fade058f9aab1a

commit_message:
[Unity] Add support of removing empty host

Add an option in Unity Cinder driver to customize the removing
of empty host. The option is named `remove_empty_host`. Its
default value is False. When it is set to True, the host will
be removed from Unity after the last LUN is detached from it.

Change-Id: I2d9fad2c977a61f5b26a6449a8e509911eff28e0
Closes-bug: #1768711

commit_message:
V3 json schema validation: generic volume groups

This patch adds jsonschema validation for below volume groups API's
* POST /v3/{project_id}/groups (create)
* PUT  /v3/{project_id}/groups/{group_id} (update)
* POST /v3/{project_id}/groups/action (create from source)
* POST /v3/{project_id}/groups/{group_id}/action (delete)
* POST /v3/{project_id}/groups/{group_id}/action (reset status)
* POST /v3/{project_id}/groups/{group_id}/action (failover replication)
* POST /v3/{project_id}/groups/{group_id}/action (enable replication)
* POST /v3/{project_id}/groups/{group_id}/action (disable replication)
* POST /v3/{project_id}/groups/{group_id}/action (list replication)

Change-Id: Ie91a52cc7f0245e5ecb3a9382691d78f5f92aa4f
Partial-Implements: bp json-schema-validation

I like the idea of having a single source for OSH instead of two where things go out of sync. Though this will break some in flight patch sets and may impact others. Soft +1 so others can review as well.'}, {'account_id': 23928, 'date': '2018-05-13 16:59:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12:

> I like the idea of having a single source for OSH instead of two
 > where things go out of sync. Though this will break some in flight
 > patch sets and may impact others. Soft +1 so others can review as
 > well.

This will certainly require some in-flight patches to be refactored,t his change is a requirement of the 1.0.0 release, and will make for a much more solid codebase moving forward: 
 * https://github.com/openstack/openstack-helm/blob/master/doc/source/specs/osh-1.0-requirements.rst#code-completion-and-refactoring'}, {'account_id': 17591, 'date': '2018-05-13 17:03:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 22477, 'date': '2018-05-13 21:07:38.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 12: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

Agree - long time coming, and it's great to get down to a single source of truth for HTK."}]

commit_message:
Remove helm-toolkit from OSH

This PS removes the helm-toolkit from OSH, and moves to use the
toolkit from OSH-Infra.

Change-Id: Ic9610bb2ed07697352bfd5849c717f6e576e3d6c
Signed-off-by: Pete Birley <pete@port.direct>

commit_message:
Update nspawn hosts

Use the common roles throught this role to remove all of the boilerplate
code we had. The common modules do most of the heavy lifing.

Update to fix the resolve.conf issue with the image cache prep.

Add legacy image support and use smaller upstream images by default.

Now that suse supports systemd-networkd we can enable suse support in
nspawn.

Change-Id: I5f6ceb928f5c0902adf2e34f96a5998840400777
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

interface of "none" instead of "public".

Sometime systems will hang when executing many systemd options at the

commit_message:
Updated systemd networkd role to fix hangs

Sometime systems will hang when executing many systemd options at the
same time. This change breaks up the systemd enabled/start/daemon_reload
tasks so that we're only enabling and starting when "systemd_run_networkd"
is set to true.

Change-Id: I3572337edc87b5753f9d4a9b480fdba76e98e8ef
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
Cinder: Use Swift for volume backups by default

This PS changes the default volume backup backend to be swift
as this is both better tested and volume driver backend agnostic,
in addition to permitting easier export of data by tenants.

commit_message:
Update auth_url value in install docs

Follow the keystone install guide by using port 5000 as the default
auth_url, this change is to update manila install guide on the version
of Queens.

Change-Id: I8862e2906d0a1eb6f5b900205b39456f6543c14c
Closes-bug: #1754104

commit_message:
Script to update RPM's in containers.

This script was living in a github repo and is used during the CI
job.  Moving it here so more people can review it.

This updates the RPM's in a container without having to rebuild
the whole thing.

Change-Id: I4905c35fcd45ef0fe1845857020c7e1a44c8c3d6

[{'created': '2018-05-13 18:46:09.000000000', 'message': 'Revert "vars: redhat-7: Prefer the cloud repository over the EPEL one"

According to [1] the repo with the lowest number has the highest
priority, and therefore it was originally correct. This change has now
set epel to a higher priority which is breaking deployments.

This reverts commit 7f073403098f13a0809c0ccc4dcdca9dd4579104.

[1] https://wiki.centos.org/PackageManagement/Yum/Priorities

Change-Id: Iea469506eb5d6a7c4118a0d441b0bf6aa8b6514b
'}]
commit_message:
Revert "vars: redhat-7: Prefer the cloud repository over the EPEL one"

According to [1] the repo with the lowest number has the highest
priority, and therefore it was originally correct. This change has now
set epel to a higher priority which is breaking deployments.

This reverts commit 7f073403098f13a0809c0ccc4dcdca9dd4579104.

[1] https://wiki.centos.org/PackageManagement/Yum/Priorities

Change-Id: Iea469506eb5d6a7c4118a0d441b0bf6aa8b6514b

commit_message:
Remove mox in test_compute_api.py (2)

Replace mox with mock in the following methods in
nova/tests/unit/compute/test_compute_api.py.

* test_delete_fast_if_host_not_set
* test_local_delete_with_deleted_volume
* test_delete_disabled
* test_delete_soft_rollback
* _test_confirm_resize

Subsequent patches will remove mox in other test
methods in the file.

Change-Id: I5b3973ac5d1838e199119e288e1b8c75da248ce1
Implements: blueprint mox-removal

Gate: Dont deploy pip dist package if already installed

This PS stops the gate playbook trying to deploy pip via dist
packages if its already deployed.

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-05-12 06:05:28.000000000', 'message': 'Revert the workarouds for kernel override

Centos 7.5 is released with the new kernel so workaround applied
for Centos 7.4 update kernel needs revert.
The patch reverts the following 4 commits applied
in order to override kernel. Some nested VMs(Skylake) have
issues running virt-customize with kvm backend, so set
LIBGUESTFS_BACKEND_SETTINGS=force_tcg to not use
kvm accelaration. Setting this option drops performance
for running virt-customize a little but can't find any other
option until it's fixed in kernel/kvm.

Revert "add option to turn on/off non default kernel"

This reverts commit fec6fd069d074a73304c3e0498a00855df2fa4c4.

Revert "Do not attempt install kernel when chrooted"

This reverts commit d991c1033f3a6390720210d682e3c155959bbe71.

Revert "Ensure libguestfs_kernel_override kernel is installed"

This reverts commit ff0a5c9ac7149e89da2c01a8e184004bb536d43e.

Revert "Set SUPERMIN_* variables to working kernel"

This reverts commit 6aac21081db4054b71257c396823b9af1d760311.

Change-Id: If46010d7ca14f9dde9a49173aa0b6de91c3826a8
Related-Bug: #1743749
'}]
commit_message:
Revert the workarouds for kernel override

Centos 7.5 is released with the new kernel so workaround applied
for Centos 7.4 update kernel needs revert.
The patch reverts the following 4 commits applied
in order to override kernel. Some nested VMs(Skylake) have
issues running virt-customize with kvm backend, so set
LIBGUESTFS_BACKEND_SETTINGS=force_tcg to not use
kvm accelaration. Setting this option drops performance
for running virt-customize a little but can't find any other
option until it's fixed in kernel/kvm.

Revert "add option to turn on/off non default kernel"

This reverts commit fec6fd069d074a73304c3e0498a00855df2fa4c4.

Revert "Do not attempt install kernel when chrooted"

This reverts commit d991c1033f3a6390720210d682e3c155959bbe71.

Revert "Ensure libguestfs_kernel_override kernel is installed"

This reverts commit ff0a5c9ac7149e89da2c01a8e184004bb536d43e.

Revert "Set SUPERMIN_* variables to working kernel"

This reverts commit 6aac21081db4054b71257c396823b9af1d760311.

Change-Id: If46010d7ca14f9dde9a49173aa0b6de91c3826a8
Related-Bug: #1743749

commit_message:
Gate: stop pulling default images

This PS stops pulling the charts default images, as the make file
target cannot target over-rides - resulting in longer gate runs with
twice as many images pulled than required in some cases.

Change-Id: I04c1d43d6ac9d2f509604709139583b085b406e3
See: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/566738/

Thank you Zenghui.'}, {'account_id': 13689, 'date': '2018-05-11 04:38:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 30:

(1 comment)

Sorry for late reply. I slightly wonder if it might be better to reconsider when to cache the BIOS configuration, though the SPEC was already approved. After caching is done at automated cleaning when a node is transited from manageable to available at setting up the node, an operator has to get the node back to manageable and run apply_configuration() as a clean step if the BIOS is misconfigured. The node in available state may be provisioned by Nova before moving back to manageable.'}, {'account_id': 21151, 'date': '2018-05-11 05:42:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 30:

> (1 comment)
 > 
 > Sorry for late reply. I slightly wonder if it might be better to
 > reconsider when to cache the BIOS configuration, though the SPEC
 > was already approved. After caching is done at automated cleaning
 > when a node is transited from manageable to available at setting up
 > the node, an operator has to get the node back to manageable and
 > run apply_configuration() as a clean step if the BIOS is
 > misconfigured. The node in available state may be provisioned by
 > Nova before moving back to manageable.

It might be good to have cache_bios_settings as another clean step so that operator can choose to update the current bios options and see if there is any mis-configuration. this will avoid aformentioned problem but only apply to manual cleaning.'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2018-05-11 08:10:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 30:

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 11655, 'date': '2018-05-11 12:55:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 30:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 11655, 'date': '2018-05-11 14:51:15.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 30:

> 
 > It might be good to have cache_bios_settings as another clean step
 > so that operator can choose to update the current bios options and
 > see if there is any mis-configuration. this will avoid
 > aformentioned problem but only apply to manual cleaning.

I agree, but I don't think that blocks us from landing this patch."}, {'account_id': 11655, 'date': '2018-05-13 13:59:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 30: Workflow+1'}]

commit_message:
BIOS Settings: Add BIOS caching

The BIOS settings will be retrieved and cached
for the node as part of entering cleaning step
in ``_do_node_clean``, this will work for both
manual and automated cleaning.

Co-Authored-By: Yolanda Robla Mota <yroblamo@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I1d56b0b5ec7e91919df43a2bec5196dc13726c26
Story: #1712032

commit_message:
Do not run functional (API) tests in the CI

These tests exercise Ironic API with the fake driver, thus they provide
no coverage for IPA and can be excluded.

Change-Id: I02eb41b112f1da413178cbdc5834d2904e9d26e9

commit_message:
Fix XClarity parameters discrepancy

The XClarity parameters required by driver_info are changed, so
that the code is consistent with the document. Besides, we add
driver information parse code to verify if it has all the required
parameters. And unit tests pass.

Add releasenotes for deprecate-xclarity-config.

Change-Id: I4412c550ae4d1f506db0c1289920e5bd62f8f724
Story: 2001841
Task: 12607

commit_message:
[doc] Add soft_deleted flag

soft_deleted is support in query but we didn't mention in the doc

https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/bcb405e871a447df57ea420402919a256f5d0be9/nova/db/sqlalchemy/api.py#L2127

Change-Id: I1c5577a501144170e82c96c04cffbf32dcaa5cff
Closes-Bug: 1765575

commit_message:
Cinder: Use correct service names for api versions

This PS updates cinder to use the correct service names for API
versions

V2:
 * https://github.com/openstack-dev/devstack/blob/stable/newton/lib/cinder#L387
 * https://github.com/openstack-dev/devstack/blob/master/lib/cinder#L381

V3:
 * https://github.com/openstack-dev/devstack/blob/stable/newton/lib/cinder#L395
 * https://github.com/openstack-dev/devstack/blob/master/lib/cinder#L387

The custom value for Nova's cinder catalog_info is also removed, as this was
required to use the incorrect service catalog names.

Change-Id: Ic88826a3c8233e260caca69272cf32021825b48c

commit_message:
Refactor, fix ansible inventory method parameters for ffwd-upgrade run

This submission had the correct fix for the bug 1769867.

[0] was accidentaly stepping over this submission
to fix the parameter configuration. Still we need
the fix for configuring the parameters correctly
also fixing the unit tests.

The method parameters wasn't being passed into the
tripleo ansible inventory generation.
Also discussed in [1].

Related-Bug: 1769867
[1]: https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1575445
[0]: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/566960/

Change-Id: I7c5347ef31aa002f22bcaa60fcbfff058ae8acb9

The latest version of pycodestyle got stricter with undefined objects
pulled in via * imports. It's a nice check and actually found a bug, so

W503 on the other hand is terrible.

Change-Id: Id73599ca494545b0f6d2345236190fc13cf2a326
"}]
commit_message:
Fix recent pep8 issues

The latest version of pycodestyle got stricter with undefined objects
pulled in via * imports. It's a nice check and actually found a bug, so
instead of disabling it, fix the places where we're using a * import.

W503 on the other hand is terrible.

Change-Id: Id73599ca494545b0f6d2345236190fc13cf2a326

commit_message:
Avoid tox-install.sh

Instead of using tox-install.sh, we can install horizon and neutron
now directly from pypi - or use the current branch in CI system using
tox-siblings.

Update tox.ini for this change and add neutron to requirements file.

This commit includes the following unrelated changes
to pass the gate.
----------------------------------------
devstack: Use setup_develop to install

As this project is in the global requirements now,
we need to edit the constraints.

Change-Id: I44e05b4e7b6f1c15314799c4a1e8c22f79abb74a
----------------------------------------
Update after rpc create_connection removal

Recently neutron.common.rpc.create_connection has been removed. [1]

[1] I2f4b24ba732be47fc9911be1e24406fb1ffe821e

Closes-Bug: #1770851
Change-Id: Ie83299b7a280dab0d5dc9dc3304b5d6091b4a0cc
----------------------------------------

Co-Authored-By: YAMAMOTO Takashi <yamamoto@midokura.com>
Change-Id: Ifffca6361b1c3991481442053bf182bde3c2d44a

commit_message:
compute: introduce cpu_shared_set option

The CONF.compute.cpu_shared_set option will be used for best-effort
guest vCPU resources.

It's to note that an other effort done by spec cpu-resources will use
that same option to provide isolation between dedicated and shared
instances. But currently outside of the scope of that whole serie.

Change-Id: Ibedd31e284ec9bc70e257e6a88b4d82b021db0fd
Partial-implement: bp/overhead-pin-set
Signed-off-by: Sahid Orentino Ferdjaoui <sahid.ferdjaoui@redhat.com>

An issue here would be that any additional actions like precreation of L7 LBaaS would not fit well in a Handler‚Ä¶"}, {'account_id': 21041, 'date': '2018-03-25 07:49:22.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

> (1 comment)

 > like precreation of L7 LBaaS would not fit well in a Handler‚Ä¶

Michal,
With Toni's patch I assume we won't need this patch any more.
Yes, that's correct the Ingress-controller doesn't fit the handler scheme, but both ocp-route and k8s-ingress handlers  will fit handlers scheme.
anyhow I should rebase the ingress controller patch (https://review.openstack.org/#/c/536387/) on top of Toni's patch.
and customize ocp-route handlers patch (https://review.openstack.org/#/c/538577/) to the pluggable handlers approach
It"}, {'account_id': 21041, 'date': '2018-05-13 10:04:11.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-25 14:47:58.000000000', 'message': 'PaaS readiness

This patch extends kuryr-kubernetes to support other platforms
(e.g: openshift) that wrap/extend kubernetes.

Partially Implements: blueprint openshift-router-support

Change-Id: I2b8126763ad7643aeea56b49c581471b8ff9cfda
'}, {'created': '2018-02-26 00:06:21.000000000', 'message': 'OCP-Router : PaaS readiness framework

OpenShift Container Platform router is the ingress point for all external
traffic destined for services in the  OpenShift cluster.
An OpenShift route object is a way to expose a service by giving it an externally-reachable
hostname like www.example.com.

This patch provides framework for kuryr-kubernetes to support
other platforms (PaaS) that wrap/extend Kubernetes (e.g: Openshift).

The OCP-Router/OCP-Route capability will be implemented based
on this framework.

Partially Implements: blueprint openshift-router-support

Change-Id: I2b8126763ad7643aeea56b49c581471b8ff9cfda

Partially Implements: blueprint openshift-router-support

Change-Id: I2b8126763ad7643aeea56b49c581471b8ff9cfda
'}]
commit_message:
OCP-Router : Platform readiness framework

OpenShift Container Platform router is the ingress point for all external
traffic destined for services in the  OpenShift cluster.
An OpenShift route object is a way to expose a service by giving it an
externally-reachable hostname like www.example.com.

This patch provides framework for kuryr-kubernetes to support
other platforms that wrap/extend Kubernetes (e.g: Openshift).

The OCP-Router/OCP-Route capability will be implemented based
on this framework.

Partially Implements: blueprint openshift-router-support

Change-Id: I2b8126763ad7643aeea56b49c581471b8ff9cfda

Deprecate non containerized undercloud

We're deprecating the non containerized undercloud in Rocky, and move
forward with containerized undercloud during the cycle.

commit_message:
puppet: deprecation message for non-containerized undercloud

Show a deprecation message in the Puppet catalog so people know we
deprecate underclouds deployed by instack-undercloud in Rocky.

Also add a release note for deprecation.

Change-Id: I4ca1478ea22060ada7f35bf74575fa08c8471d73

commit_message:
Heat: Dont deploy cloudwatch by default

As per the Wiki page [1] and discussions on the openstack-dev
mailing list [2], heat-api-cloudwatch was depreciated following
the liberty cycle and slated for removal. It was fully removed
during the queens development cycle.

[1] https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Heat/Using-CloudWatch
[2] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-April/061834.html

Change-Id: I5c5461839f2351c3955efaec613bd4bcc7174f78

commit_message:
Avoid warning log when image not exist

when doing snapshot nova try to get image info and
normal case is image doesn't exist but nova shows
a warning log ,this patch change the mechanism to
only log unexpected exception as warning.

Change-Id: I49618a6dafbe00b9516ff37172b6aea68a42deba
Closes-Bug: 1754071

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-05-09 05:31:17.000000000', 'message': 'Add xstatic projects

New xstatic projects are added and released on pypi site.
Add them to global requirements for referencing by other projects.

* Is the library actively maintained?

Yes. Maintained as xstatic projects.

* Is the library good code?

Yes. Published javascript code are adopted.

* Is the library python 3 compatible?

Yes.

* Is the library license compatible?

Yes. All provided with MIT License.

* Is the library already packaged in the distros we target
(Ubuntu latest / Fedora latest)?

Yes. Released on pypi site and can be simply installed with pip.

* Is the function of this library already covered
by other libraries in global-requirements.txt?

No. New functions are provided.

* Is the library required for OpenStack project
or related dev or infrastructure setup?

Yes. openstack/release changes are as follows.
xstatic-angular-uuid 558989
xstatic-angular-vis 559005
xstatic-filesaver 559007
xstatic-json2yaml 559017
xstatic-js-yaml 559028

* If the library release is managed by the Openstack release process
 does it use the cycle-with-intermediary release type?

No. Managed by openstack/release as xstatic type.

* Do I need to update anything else?

I am not sure but think the answer is NO.
Changes to upper-constraints.txt and lower-constraints.txt
are already included in this commit.

Change-Id: I1112aea8a19c72abcbec8ea63b51c68f3486dcbc

commit_message:
Add xstatic projects

New xstatic projects are added and released on pypi site.
Add them to global requirements for referencing by other projects.

* Is the library actively maintained?

Yes. Maintained as xstatic projects.

* Is the library good code?

Yes. Published javascript code are adopted.

* Is the library python 3 compatible?

Yes.

* Is the library license compatible?

Yes. All provided with MIT License.

* Is the library already packaged in the distros we target
(Ubuntu latest / Fedora latest)?

Yes. Released on pypi site and can be simply installed with pip.

* Is the function of this library already covered
by other libraries in global-requirements.txt?

No. New functions are provided.

* Is the library required for OpenStack project
or related dev or infrastructure setup?

Yes. openstack/release changes are as follows.
xstatic-angular-uuid 558989
xstatic-angular-vis 559005
xstatic-filesaver 559007
xstatic-json2yaml 559017
xstatic-js-yaml 559028

* If the library release is managed by the Openstack release process
 does it use the cycle-with-intermediary release type?

No. Managed by openstack/release as xstatic type.

* Do I need to update anything else?

I am not sure but think the answer is NO.
Changes to upper-constraints.txt and lower-constraints.txt
are already included in this commit.

Change-Id: I1112aea8a19c72abcbec8ea63b51c68f3486dcbc

commit_message:
Initial draft specification of introspective instance monitoring.

Specifically VM Heartbeat Monitoring via the QEMU Guest Agent.

Implements-blueprint: introspective-instance-monitoring
Change-Id: Ie41d92651128b41967c1118bbcdaf3656c498801
Signed-off-by: Greg Waines <greg.waines@windriver.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-21 05:38:22.000000000', 'message': '[WIP] Update for upcoming openstacksdk changes to masakari-monitors

The resource2/proxy2 migration is finally done, so resource2/proxy2 will
be resource/proxy in the next openstacksdk release.

In the release after that, Profile is going away as are entrypoints
plugins. This handles fixing most of that in a way that should work with
both old and new.

Note: This code has been tested only by openstacksdk-0.11.3, but not
tested by the other versions.

Change-Id: I788e9f24f50e54cf4d1111386fa1392bd1b99e00
'}, {'created': '2018-02-21 10:47:20.000000000', 'message': '[WIP] Update for upcoming openstacksdk changes to masakari-monitors

commit_message:
Update for new openstacksdk changes to masakari-monitors

In new openstacksdk release, 'Profile' is removed in favour of
entrypoints plugins. This patch makes masakari-monitor compatible
with such new changes in openstacksdk.

NOTE:
To fix masakari-monitor this patch requires openstacksdk version to
be minimum 0.13.0.

Change-Id: I788e9f24f50e54cf4d1111386fa1392bd1b99e00

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 9708, 'date': '2018-05-02 08:40:50.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 11: Code-Review-1

(2 comments)

I'm hesitant to +W this and just ask for a follow up due to the unnecessarily old microversion usage in the functional test. But I can be convinced that it is good to go by providing that follow up patch :)


Cheers,
gibi"}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-05-02 13:02:48.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 11:

(2 comments)

I tend to think we shouldn't land this until we have agreement on what to do about rebuild, because once we start supporting these types of images during server create, we're committed to resolving the rebuild issue."}, {'account_id': 17190, 'date': '2018-05-02 15:48:14.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 11:

(2 comments)

> (2 comments)
 > 
 > I'm hesitant to +W this and just ask for a follow up due to the
 > unnecessarily old microversion usage in the functional test. But I
 > can be convinced that it is good to go by providing that follow up
 > patch :)
 > 
 > 
 > Cheers,
 > gibi

using the image proxy API seems to be a cleaner solution and closer to the real world than trying to use the fake image service directly which is intended to be internal.

There are other places in the code where we resort to microversion changes for api so we are consistent. https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/aa537551dc5f8ff45d2a679fb68a867f449be73d/nova/tests/functional/test_servers.py#L1141

 > (2 comments)
 > 
 > I tend to think we shouldn't land this until we have agreement on
 > what to do about rebuild, because once we start supporting these
 > types of images during server create, we're committed to resolving
 > the rebuild issue.

i am guessing with all the solutions out there, we just need to pick one :). If there was no way to implement any of the approaches, then i would be worried.

Code wise, none of the implementations for rebuild touch the same code, so it should be fine to merge this IMO."}, {'account_id': 17190, 'date': '2018-05-02 16:38:25.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 12.'}, {'account_id': 26515, 'date': '2018-05-02 16:41:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12:

For rechecking only on the Cloudbase Hyper-V CI, add a review comment with check hyper-v

- nova-dsvm-full-tempest http://cloudbase-ci.com//nova/560596/12/ : FAILURE in 2m 17s'}, {'account_id': 23498, 'date': '2018-05-02 17:37:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12:

Testing completed on the zVM Driver CI system check-nova pipeline.  To recheck only the zVM driver plugins, submit a comment with only zvm: recheck in the comment. Contact information: zvmosci@us.ibm.com. For information see https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/ZVMDriver.

- check-nova-master http://extbasicopstackcilog01.podc.sl.edst.ibm.com/test_logs/jenkins-check-nova-master-17737 : SUCCESS in 56m 56s'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2018-05-02 19:16:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12: Code-Review+1

(1 comment)

Soft approve until gibi is happy and we have a statement of direction on the rebuild issue.'}, {'account_id': 9708, 'date': '2018-05-03 15:15:52.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 12: Code-Review+2

> (1 comment)
 > 
 > Soft approve until gibi is happy and we have a statement of
 > direction on the rebuild issue.

I feel we agreed on a way forward with the rebuild issue on the today's nova meeting. Also I can accept using the old microversion as it is just in the test so it is easy to change later if needed.

Cheers,
gibi"}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-05-03 15:20:10.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 12: Workflow-1

I'd like to make sure we're clear on the rebuild direction before we move further with this series."}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2018-05-07 13:23:50.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 12: Code-Review+2

Spec delta for rebuild is merged.  I think we're ready to move forward with this."}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-05-08 16:10:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 12: Code-Review-1 -Workflow

We should have a functional test for this. Unit tests don't really cut it when we're dealing with multiple services here (api, scheduler, placement). There are existing tests within nova.tests.functional.test_servers that you could build from, the ones that use ProviderUsageMixin. You should be able to add a custom trait to a compute node resource provider and then set that same required trait in the image metadata and make sure the scheduler picks that host (so you likely need two compute node providers, one with the trait and one without)."}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-05-08 16:11:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12: -Code-Review

Guh nevermind, totally missed the functional tests you already added.'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-05-08 16:22:49.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 12:

(2 comments)

It would probably be good to have a functional test for a volume-backed instance to show that we don't consider the required image traits in that case at all. Also, were you going to add a release note for this at some point?"}, {'account_id': 17190, 'date': '2018-05-10 19:38:18.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 13.'}, {'account_id': 17190, 'date': '2018-05-10 20:07:07.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 14.'}, {'account_id': 17190, 'date': '2018-05-10 20:15:12.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 12:

(2 comments)

> (2 comments)
 > 
 > It would probably be good to have a functional test for a
 > volume-backed instance to show that we don't consider the 
 > required image traits in that case at all. Also, were you going 
 > to add a release note for this at some point?
add functional tests to make sure we do consider the image traits for volume backed instances. see bug1175571. Volume image meta data is considered equivalent to image meta data during scheduling...so continuing the same.

This new functionality will be documented as described in the spec as part of future patch in the current release. 

https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/nova-specs/specs/rocky/approved/glance-image-traits.html#documentation-impact"}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2018-05-10 20:29:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 14: Code-Review-1

(4 comments)

Quick update to a docstring, please.'}, {'account_id': 17190, 'date': '2018-05-10 20:53:41.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 15.'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2018-05-10 20:55:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 15: Code-Review+2

lgtm, thanks Arvind.'}, {'account_id': 23498, 'date': '2018-05-10 21:58:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 15:
