For rechecking only on the Cloudbase Hyper-V CI, add a review comment with check hyper-v

- nova-dsvm-full-tempest http://cloudbase-ci.com//nova/560596/15/ : FAILURE in 1h 49m 34s'}, {'account_id': 27336, 'date': '2018-05-10 23:04:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 15: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-05-11 20:55:20.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 15: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

(9 comments)

I've got some nits inline that could be dealt with in a follow up change, otherwise this looks OK to me, nice test coverage, and had a +2 from gibi before also."}, {'account_id': 17190, 'date': '2018-05-11 23:38:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 15:

the fixes will be included in the next patch.'}]

commit_message:
update scheduler to use image-traits

Update the scheduler to take into account the traits specified
as part of the image properties. The required traits from the
image are added to the resource request along with the traits
and resources from the flavor.

This change does not handle rebuilding of the instance, this
will come as part of a follow on patch.

Added unit and functional tests

Change-Id: I3e00080a6b557c6a27634b1dc04fc589f0da0bc2
Implements: blueprint glance-image-traits

commit_message:
DNM: Testing ability to load certs

Patch set to load the certificates so we can remove all the
insecure calling mechanisms.

TODO:
- Refactor the cert load logic
- Add in fedora/centos specific commands in addition to ubuntu

Signed-off-by: Tin Lam <tin@irrational.io>

commit_message:
Ceph: Setup radosgw with increased swift support.

This PS updates the cephs config to deploy radosgw with greater
swift compatibility. Allowing clients to use RGW as though it
were a real swift deployment.

Change-Id: Id0a27b42b7f9c0c9e4b5a197ef50feb612e6adfc

better overall performance. This change adds several options which will

 * https://btrfs.wiki.kernel.org/index.php/Manpage/btrfs(5)#MOUNT_OPTIONS

To ensure these new options are not distruptive, the mount handler has
been changed to use "reload-or-restart" which will ensure mounts can be
reloaded instead of restarted.

Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
'}, {'created': '2018-03-30 18:12:39.000000000', 'message': 'Add mount options for better machinectl performance

commit_message:
Add mount options for better machinectl performance

The machinectl default options, while functional, could be tuned for
better overall performance. This change adds several options which will
ensure container workloads are using the lest amount of storage with the
best possible performance.

For more information on the options being used see
 * https://btrfs.wiki.kernel.org/index.php/Manpage/btrfs(5)#MOUNT_OPTIONS

All of the "machines" mount procedures have been moved into a unified
volume task file. This was done to ensure a consistent experience across
our supported distros. To ensure any new options are non-disruptive, the
mount handler has been changed to use "reload-or-restart" which will first
try to reload a mount instead of restarting it mounts.

Change-Id: Ia962fd4c5bb2a73ddd884d3bb3837c47b43d6903
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
Add local-registry image managment to OSH from OSH-Infra

This PS adds the local registry image managment to OSH from OSH-Infra.
With this the delta between helm-toolkits in the Repo's is removed,
allowing the toolkit from OSH-Infra to be used and the one from OSH
to be depreciated.

Change-Id: If5e218cf7df17261fe5ef249d281f9d9637e2f6a
Co-Authored-By: Pete Birley <pete@port.direct>

commit_message:
Fix wrong value key in glance clean-image script

This PS reflects updated value key to the glance clean-image
script to fix a bug that the bootstrapped images are not deleted
when the chart is deleted.

Change-Id: I6bd126049c539a74e23a1ca5d2957b89fdea78fc

commit_message:
Fill update, rebuild, list API response schema for 2.47

Microversion 2.47 has changed the response of update
list, and rebuild API also but we did not updated corresponding
response schema.

Also this commits add single test which covers the schema change
of microversions 2.9, 2.19, 2.26 and 2.47.

-https://docs.openstack.org/nova/latest/reference/api-microversion-history.html#id42

Change-Id: I64cc37c78bcded9d4dd85b7003319a17f3ac2137

commit_message:
Update auth_url in install docs

Beginning with the Queens release, the keystone install guide
recommends running all interfaces on the same port. This patch
updates the install guide to reflect that change.

Change-Id: I22d38193b4ecec6b6a2b43de770ea532767a5c7c

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-05-11 19:17:49.000000000', 'message': 'Fix pep8 warnings for build directory

Pep8 was producing warnings about files in the doc/build
directory.  These warning are not necessary.  This change
adds --ignore-path for those things that do not need to
be verified by pep8/doc8 .

Change-Id: Icb83d5d7e87ea75e3296e33e0e726e2374948f57
'}]
commit_message:
Fix pep8 warnings for build directory

Pep8 was producing warnings about files in the doc/build
directory.  These warning are not necessary.  This change
adds --ignore-path for those things that do not need to
be verified by pep8/doc8 .

Change-Id: Icb83d5d7e87ea75e3296e33e0e726e2374948f57

Testing completed on the zVM Driver CI system check-nova pipeline.  To recheck only the zVM driver plugins, submit a comment with only zvm: recheck in the comment. Contact information: zvmosci@us.ibm.com. For information see https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/ZVMDriver.

- check-nova-master http://extbasicopstackcilog01.podc.sl.edst.ibm.com/test_logs/jenkins-check-nova-master-15738 : SUCCESS in 1h 10m 19s'}, {'account_id': 26515, 'date': '2018-03-30 00:37:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Build succeeded.

- nova-dsvm-full-tempest http://cloudbase-ci.com/nova/557835/1/ : SUCCESS in 3h 05m 23s'}, {'account_id': 7634, 'date': '2018-03-30 06:58:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2018-04-02 17:26:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

We already have a problem with routines in generic locations doing things that assume the hypervisor is Linux.  Having methods running Linux network command lines in a module called linux_net makes sense to me.  Having them in a module called nova network utils, not so much.  Are we ultimately trying to get rid of the linux_net module?  Perhaps it makes more sense to get rid of the other stuff in it...'}, {'account_id': 2271, 'date': '2018-04-03 11:31:50.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Hi Eric,

Unfortunately, linux_net is the name of the nova-network driver in nova. That is, that module name (and its path) is the string that a user enters into a configuration flag in order to use nova-network. It isn't really something that we can move nova-network things _out_ of.

I can rename the utilities module if you'd like, but given that other changes which have already used that name have merged that seems a little over the top to me.

Michael"}, {'account_id': 2271, 'date': '2018-04-03 11:41:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Sorry Takashi, I failed to add a new unit test file to git before upload. I will fix that and re-upload.'}, {'account_id': 2271, 'date': '2018-04-03 11:54:25.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 23498, 'date': '2018-04-03 12:54:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Testing completed on the zVM Driver CI system check-nova pipeline.  To recheck only the zVM driver plugins, submit a comment with only zvm: recheck in the comment. Contact information: zvmosci@us.ibm.com. For information see https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/ZVMDriver.

- check-nova-master http://extbasicopstackcilog01.podc.sl.edst.ibm.com/test_logs/jenkins-check-nova-master-15996 : SUCCESS in 58m 16s'}, {'account_id': 26515, 'date': '2018-04-03 15:12:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

For rechecking only on the Cloudbase Hyper-V CI, add a review comment with check hyper-v

- nova-dsvm-full-tempest http://cloudbase-ci.com//nova/557835/2/ : FAILURE in 3h 17m 34s'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2018-04-03 15:15:37.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

@mikal

Doesn't seem over the top at all.  This is clearly a module of linux network utilities.  Calling it nova.network.linux_utils seems more than reasonable to me.

But in a separate patch.

Move another generally useful utility method out of nova-net to

(4 comments)'}, {'account_id': 8655, 'date': '2018-05-02 10:39:54.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: Code-Review-1

I can't set a WIP here, comments in PS4 are not answered."}, {'account_id': 9107, 'date': '2018-05-02 11:09:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 9107, 'date': '2018-05-02 11:14:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

Example using the -batch option:

$ sudo ip netns exec test /bin/echo Hello World
Hello World
$ cat x.sh 
netns exec test echo "Bug"
$ sudo ip -batch x.sh netns exec test /bin/echo Hello World
Bug

Oh, when -batch is used, the netns command is ignored?'}, {'account_id': 8655, 'date': '2018-05-02 11:32:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

(3 comments)'}, {'account_id': 9107, 'date': '2018-05-02 11:42:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

> Regarding -family - that's to keep previous functionality. This patch was about fixing bypassing "ip net e" usage in rootwrap so attacker won't be able to get root permissions on box filesystem anymore.

I understand, but I'm not sure that it's worth it to close a single bug using a blacklist approach, if there is a known way to still bypass the filter (-batch option). I prefer the strict whitelist approach (only allow "ip netns exec ..."), and fix services if they use a weird syntax or useless options.'}, {'account_id': 8655, 'date': '2018-05-02 11:53:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 8655, 'date': '2018-05-10 10:03:54.000000000', 'content': 'Removed reviewer Jakub Libosvar with the following votes:

* Code-Review-1 by Jakub Libosvar <jlibosva-redhat@email.cz>
'}, {'account_id': 8655, 'date': '2018-05-10 10:24:52.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 8655, 'date': '2018-05-10 10:28:33.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 8655, 'date': '2018-05-10 12:40:48.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 23804, 'date': '2018-05-10 15:14:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2018-05-11 07:54:31.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8: Code-Review+2

Looks like a good incremental improvement...

I would still urge any project consuming oslo.rootwrap to migrate to oslo.privsep since default filters can still very much be abused, and it's simpler to migrate to a better solution than write specific filters everywhere :)"}, {'account_id': 9796, 'date': '2018-05-12 11:22:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-26 16:38:27.000000000', 'message': "WIP Make IpNetnsExecFilter more strict to detect aliases

Currently, this filter only takes into account 'ip netns exec' as
input but this command accepts different aliases like 'ip net e' or
'ip netn ex', etcetera. This is a security issue since bypassing
this filter basically allows anyone to execute arbitary commands
because IpFilter will get hit and there's not going to be any
further checks against CommandFilters.

NOTE: I'll upload unit tests ASAP.

Change-Id: I2f6e55de4e60f2d3a6166c2fefbc31e9afc6c26f
Closes-Bug: 1765734
Co-Authored-By: Jakub Libosvar <jlibosva@redhat.com>
Signed-off-by: Daniel Alvarez <dalvarez@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Make IpNetnsExecFilter more strict to detect aliases

Currently, this filter only takes into account 'ip netns exec' as
input but this command accepts different aliases like 'ip net e' or
'ip netn ex', etcetera. This is a security issue since bypassing
this filter basically allows anyone to execute arbitary commands
because IpFilter will get hit and there's not going to be any
further checks against CommandFilters.

Change-Id: I2f6e55de4e60f2d3a6166c2fefbc31e9afc6c26f
Closes-Bug: 1765734
Co-Authored-By: Jakub Libosvar <jlibosva@redhat.com>
Signed-off-by: Daniel Alvarez <dalvarez@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Add private_key to the list of sanitized keys

Nova's create keypair operation will currently log the generated
keypair if debug logs are enabled.

Closes-Bug: #1770683
Change-Id: I7f889f0bf254fad43b1e26d32fa145f88c668b39

Before this patch, when unprovisioning a node, the console was left
running. This allowed a user to view the console even after the instance
was gone. Stop the console during unprovisioning to block this.

ConductorManager._set_console_mode will now bubble up any exceptions

Change-Id: Iec128444d692e0b0fbc1737eb21b0e6f69b7ec1e

commit_message:
Tear down console during unprovisioning

Before this patch, when unprovisioning a node, the console was left
running. This allowed a user to view the console even after the instance
was gone. Stop the console during unprovisioning to block this.

ConductorManager._set_console_mode will now bubble up any exceptions
raised, so that we can explode as needed during unprovisioning. This
does not have any side effects, as elsewhere it is run in it's own
thread and execution was complete after handling the exception.

Also change a few mock.ANY in the relevant unit tests to the actual task
object, as cleanup.

Conflicts:
	ironic/tests/unit/conductor/test_manager.py

Change-Id: Iec128444d692e0b0fbc1737eb21b0e6f69b7ec1e
Partial-Bug: #1769817
Story: #2002000
Task: #19634
(cherry picked from commit 7a8b26db6b48f5593786bb92cf09fa1d6afcc1ea)

commit_message:
Move Patch Best Practices

As only code and documentation contributors (not users or operators)
will be interested in how to create a good patch, this patch moves that
file to the code-and-docs directory from the common directory and
updates the index in code-and-docs to reflect the change.

Change-Id: Ia5cb5cae92eee73200f39c4b6c6e5d84337b85ab

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-05-04 17:12:08.000000000', 'message': "libvirt: check image type before removing snapshots in _cleanup_resize

Change Ic683f83e428106df64be42287e2c5f3b40e73da4 added some disk
cleanup logic to _cleanup_resize because some image backends (Qcow2,
Flat and Ploop) will re-create the instance directory and disk.info
file when initializing the image backend object.

However, that change did not take into account volume-backed instances
being resized will not have a root disk *and* if the local disk is
shared storage, removing the instance directory effectively deletes
the instance files, like the console.log, on the destination host
as well. Change I29fac80d08baf64bf69e54cf673e55123174de2a was made
to resolve that issue.

However (see the pattern?), if you're doing a resize of a
volume-backed instance that is not on shared storage, we won't remove
the instance directory from the source host in _cleanup_resize. If the
admin then later tries to live migrate the instance back to that host,
it will fail with DestinationDiskExists in the pre_live_migration()
method.

This change is essentially a revert of
I29fac80d08baf64bf69e54cf673e55123174de2a and alternate fix for
Ic683f83e428106df64be42287e2c5f3b40e73da4. Since the root problem
is that creating certain imagebackend objects will recreate the
instance directory and disk.info on the source host, we simply need
to avoid creating the imagebackend object. The only reason we are
getting an imagebackend object in _cleanup_resize is to remove
image snapshot clones, which is only implemented by the Rbd image
backend. Therefore, we can check to see if the image type supports
clones and if not, don't go through the imagebackend init routine
that, for some, will recreate the disk.

Change-Id: Ib10081150e125961cba19cfa821bddfac4614408
Closes-Bug: #1769131
Related-Bug: #1666831
Related-Bug: #1728603
"}, {'created': '2018-05-08 16:36:19.000000000', 'message': "libvirt: check image type before removing snapshots in _cleanup_resize

Change Ic683f83e428106df64be42287e2c5f3b40e73da4 added some disk
cleanup logic to _cleanup_resize because some image backends (Qcow2,
Flat and Ploop) will re-create the instance directory and disk.info
file when initializing the image backend object.

However, that change did not take into account volume-backed instances
being resized will not have a root disk *and* if the local disk is
shared storage, removing the instance directory effectively deletes
the instance files, like the console.log, on the destination host
as well. Change I29fac80d08baf64bf69e54cf673e55123174de2a was made
to resolve that issue.

However (see the pattern?), if you're doing a resize of a
volume-backed instance that is not on shared storage, we won't remove
the instance directory from the source host in _cleanup_resize. If the
admin then later tries to live migrate the instance back to that host,
it will fail with DestinationDiskExists in the pre_live_migration()
method.

This change is essentially a revert of
I29fac80d08baf64bf69e54cf673e55123174de2a and alternate fix for
Ic683f83e428106df64be42287e2c5f3b40e73da4. Since the root problem
is that creating certain imagebackend objects will recreate the
instance directory and disk.info on the source host, we simply need
to avoid creating the imagebackend object. The only reason we are
getting an imagebackend object in _cleanup_resize is to remove
image snapshot clones, which is only implemented by the Rbd image
backend. Therefore, we can check to see if the image type supports
clones and if not, don't go through the imagebackend init routine
that, for some, will recreate the disk.

Change-Id: Ib10081150e125961cba19cfa821bddfac4614408
Closes-Bug: #1769131
Related-Bug: #1666831
Related-Bug: #1728603
"}]
commit_message:
libvirt: check image type before removing snapshots in _cleanup_resize

Change Ic683f83e428106df64be42287e2c5f3b40e73da4 added some disk
cleanup logic to _cleanup_resize because some image backends (Qcow2,
Flat and Ploop) will re-create the instance directory and disk.info
file when initializing the image backend object.

However, that change did not take into account volume-backed instances
being resized will not have a root disk *and* if the local disk is
shared storage, removing the instance directory effectively deletes
the instance files, like the console.log, on the destination host
as well. Change I29fac80d08baf64bf69e54cf673e55123174de2a was made
to resolve that issue.

However (see the pattern?), if you're doing a resize of a
volume-backed instance that is not on shared storage, we won't remove
the instance directory from the source host in _cleanup_resize. If the
admin then later tries to live migrate the instance back to that host,
it will fail with DestinationDiskExists in the pre_live_migration()
method.

This change is essentially a revert of
I29fac80d08baf64bf69e54cf673e55123174de2a and alternate fix for
Ic683f83e428106df64be42287e2c5f3b40e73da4. Since the root problem
is that creating certain imagebackend objects will recreate the
instance directory and disk.info on the source host, we simply need
to avoid creating the imagebackend object. The only reason we are
getting an imagebackend object in _cleanup_resize is to remove
image snapshot clones, which is only implemented by the Rbd image
backend. Therefore, we can check to see if the image type supports
clones and if not, don't go through the imagebackend init routine
that, for some, will recreate the disk.

Change-Id: Ib10081150e125961cba19cfa821bddfac4614408
Closes-Bug: #1769131
Related-Bug: #1666831
Related-Bug: #1728603

commit_message:
Update wording used in removal of VIFs

Some minor updates were done to the wording used in the
removal-of-VIFs change.  This is a follow up to
3a4e259a3714cedcad567e229e983f1b559c2668.

Change-Id: I4a72535fed3650364aa53f1f22676599499a3d62
Story: #1743652
Task: #9275
(cherry picked from commit 05dd4050f70343062128da745817d31e57e7bf23)

commit_message:
Fill update, rebuild API response schema for 2.26

Microversion 2.26 has changed the response of update
and rebuild API also but we did not updated corresponding
response schema.

Note- We will add test for testing thes schema later along
with other microversion tests which change same APIs.

-https://docs.openstack.org/nova/latest/reference/api-microversion-history.html#id23

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-05-10 16:17:40.000000000', 'message': "libvirt: check image type before removing snapshots in _cleanup_resize

Change Ic683f83e428106df64be42287e2c5f3b40e73da4 added some disk
cleanup logic to _cleanup_resize because some image backends (Qcow2,
Flat and Ploop) will re-create the instance directory and disk.info
file when initializing the image backend object.

However, that change did not take into account volume-backed instances
being resized will not have a root disk *and* if the local disk is
shared storage, removing the instance directory effectively deletes
the instance files, like the console.log, on the destination host
as well. Change I29fac80d08baf64bf69e54cf673e55123174de2a was made
to resolve that issue.

However (see the pattern?), if you're doing a resize of a
volume-backed instance that is not on shared storage, we won't remove
the instance directory from the source host in _cleanup_resize. If the
admin then later tries to live migrate the instance back to that host,
it will fail with DestinationDiskExists in the pre_live_migration()
method.

This change is essentially a revert of
I29fac80d08baf64bf69e54cf673e55123174de2a and alternate fix for
Ic683f83e428106df64be42287e2c5f3b40e73da4. Since the root problem
is that creating certain imagebackend objects will recreate the
instance directory and disk.info on the source host, we simply need
to avoid creating the imagebackend object. The only reason we are
getting an imagebackend object in _cleanup_resize is to remove
image snapshot clones, which is only implemented by the Rbd image
backend. Therefore, we can check to see if the image type supports
clones and if not, don't go through the imagebackend init routine
that, for some, will recreate the disk.

Change-Id: Ib10081150e125961cba19cfa821bddfac4614408
Closes-Bug: #1769131
Related-Bug: #1666831
Related-Bug: #1728603
(cherry picked from commit 8e3385707cb1ced55cd12b1314d8c0b68d354c38)
(cherry picked from commit 174764340d3c965d31143b39af4ab2e8ecefe594)
(cherry picked from commit c72a0a7665e96219f0301525edc513dda07b320b)
"}]
commit_message:
libvirt: check image type before removing snapshots in _cleanup_resize

Change Ic683f83e428106df64be42287e2c5f3b40e73da4 added some disk
cleanup logic to _cleanup_resize because some image backends (Qcow2,
Flat and Ploop) will re-create the instance directory and disk.info
file when initializing the image backend object.

However, that change did not take into account volume-backed instances
being resized will not have a root disk *and* if the local disk is
shared storage, removing the instance directory effectively deletes
the instance files, like the console.log, on the destination host
as well. Change I29fac80d08baf64bf69e54cf673e55123174de2a was made
to resolve that issue.

However (see the pattern?), if you're doing a resize of a
volume-backed instance that is not on shared storage, we won't remove
the instance directory from the source host in _cleanup_resize. If the
admin then later tries to live migrate the instance back to that host,
it will fail with DestinationDiskExists in the pre_live_migration()
method.

This change is essentially a revert of
I29fac80d08baf64bf69e54cf673e55123174de2a and alternate fix for
Ic683f83e428106df64be42287e2c5f3b40e73da4. Since the root problem
is that creating certain imagebackend objects will recreate the
instance directory and disk.info on the source host, we simply need
to avoid creating the imagebackend object. The only reason we are
getting an imagebackend object in _cleanup_resize is to remove
image snapshot clones, which is only implemented by the Rbd image
backend. Therefore, we can check to see if the image type supports
clones and if not, don't go through the imagebackend init routine
that, for some, will recreate the disk.

Change-Id: Ib10081150e125961cba19cfa821bddfac4614408
Closes-Bug: #1769131
Related-Bug: #1666831
Related-Bug: #1728603
(cherry picked from commit 8e3385707cb1ced55cd12b1314d8c0b68d354c38)
(cherry picked from commit 174764340d3c965d31143b39af4ab2e8ecefe594)
(cherry picked from commit c72a0a7665e96219f0301525edc513dda07b320b)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-11 13:23:36.000000000', 'message': "Increment resource atomic key when storing attributes

When we store resource attribute values in the database, we increment the
atomic_key in the DB. This means we should also increment the _atomic_key
member of the Resource object, so that any future writes to the database
will expect the correct key.

In practice, this doesn't matter because there's no RPC API call that
stores attributes and then writes to the resource in the database for other
reasons. (Attributes are updated if they are missing on show-stack with
outputs, which is otherwise a read-only call; they're also updated at the
very end of a check-resource call in convergence.) But by maintaining a
consistent model this could help to prevent future bugs.

Change-Id: I71ed5907d33f2293c04ad3bace639b1d114e9a77
Related-Bug: #1763021
"}]
commit_message:
Increment resource atomic key when storing attributes

When we store resource attribute values in the database, we increment the
atomic_key in the DB. This means we should also increment the _atomic_key
member of the Resource object, so that any future writes to the database
will expect the correct key.

In practice, this doesn't matter because there's no RPC API call that
stores attributes and then writes to the resource in the database for other
reasons. (Attributes are updated if they are missing on show-stack with
outputs, which is otherwise a read-only call; they're also updated at the
very end of a check-resource call in convergence.) But by maintaining a
consistent model this could help to prevent future bugs.

Change-Id: I71ed5907d33f2293c04ad3bace639b1d114e9a77
Related-Bug: #1763021

commit_message:
Replace cluster object's host with service_topic_queue

We have upgrade OVO's 'host' attribute  by 'service_topic_queue'
when sending rpc messages to support cluster deployment, there
are some left unchanged, fix it.

TrivialFix

Change-Id: I842a15290599181d8d20eb436764764fc9f10687

commit_message:
Remove mox in unit/virt/xenapi/test_vmops.py

Replace mox with mock in
nova/tests/unit/virt/xenapi/test_vmops.py.

The 'stubout_session' will be modified
at the same time when nova/tests/unit/virt/xenapi/stubs.by
is modified in another patch.

Change-Id: I192a67585d81cc76980139ee8f8f046d4029ecfe
Implements: blueprint mox-removal

Remove mox in test_xenapi.py (2)

in nova/tests/unit/virt/xenapi/test_xenapi.py.

* XenAPIHostTest
* XenAPIAutoDiskConfigTestCase
* XenAPIGenerateLocal
* XenAPIBWCountersTestCase
* XenAPIDom0IptablesFirewallTestCase
* XenAPIAggregateTestCase

A subsequent patch will remove mox in other test methods
in the file.

Change-Id: I65f136c3684759f07e23c6c825cc82c2fa1e1afa
Implements: blueprint mox-removal

[{'created': '2018-05-04 19:48:54.000000000', 'message': 'Change metadata agent to log message after failure

If the metadata agent fails to send its report_state
to the server, it logs an exception:

   Failed reporting state!: MessagingTimeout: Timed out...

If it then tries a second time (on 30 second intervals)
it just goes on happily.  It would be nice if it logged
that it had success on the subsequent attempt so someone
looking at the logs know it recovered.

Change-Id: I7a826811a889c618a39a8a91c8157e1805a327eb
'}]
commit_message:
Change metadata agent to log message after failure

If the metadata agent fails to send its report_state
to the server, it logs an exception:

   Failed reporting state!: MessagingTimeout: Timed out...

If it then tries a second time (on 30 second intervals)
it just goes on happily.  It would be nice if it logged
that it had success on the subsequent attempt so someone
looking at the logs know it recovered.

Change-Id: I7a826811a889c618a39a8a91c8157e1805a327eb

commit_message:
trivial: Fix file permissions

None of these should be executable, from what I can tell.

Side note: never backup a git repo to an NTFS drive or you lose all your
permissions and need hacks to restore them.

Change-Id: I34de5488129c575a66b38b400c31393fb511765f
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>

subject: Restore Ambari with newer JDK security policies
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-05-11 23:11:19.000000000', 'message': 'Restore Ambari with newer JDK security policies

Recent changes in JDK security policies disabled TLSv1, which is used
by default in the communications between ambari-agent and ambari-server.
More details here:
https://community.hortonworks.com/articles/188269/javapython-updates-and-ambari-agent-tls-settings.html

In order to restore the functionalities, two changes are needed:
- Ambari 2.4.3.0, a minor update in the 2.4.x line;
- a change in the ambari-agent configuration file to force a newer TLS.

Story: 2002012
Task: 19651
Change-Id: I3782ce9acb8c895e4e1f3fb9046b54f2a57acdbf
(cherry picked from commit 522627e0e6ba1686bdb2cfdfde279da9ef6d615c)
'}]
commit_message:
Restore Ambari with newer JDK security policies

Recent changes in JDK security policies disabled TLSv1, which is used
by default in the communications between ambari-agent and ambari-server.
More details here:
https://community.hortonworks.com/articles/188269/javapython-updates-and-ambari-agent-tls-settings.html

In order to restore the functionalities, two changes are needed:
- Ambari 2.4.3.0, a minor update in the 2.4.x line;
- a change in the ambari-agent configuration file to force a newer TLS.

Story: 2002012
Task: 19651
Change-Id: I3782ce9acb8c895e4e1f3fb9046b54f2a57acdbf
(cherry picked from commit 522627e0e6ba1686bdb2cfdfde279da9ef6d615c)

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 4257, 'name': 'Zane Bitter', 'email': 'zbitter@redhat.com', 'username': 'zaneb'}, {'_account_id': 7385, 'name': 'Thomas Herve', 'email': 'therve@redhat.com', 'username': 'therve'}, {'_account_id': 8289, 'name': 'huangtianhua', 'email': 'tiantian223@163.com', 'username': 'huangtianhua'}, {'_account_id': 8833, 'name': 'Rabi Mishra', 'email': 'ramishra@redhat.com', 'username': 'rabi'}, {'_account_id': 10239, 'name': 'Dmitry Tantsur', 'email': 'dtantsur@protonmail.com', 'username': 'dtantsur'}, {'_account_id': 11655, 'name': 'Julia Kreger', 'email': 'juliaashleykreger@gmail.com', 'username': 'jkreger', 'status': 'On the moon! With a jetpack!'}, {'_account_id': 12404, 'name': 'Rico Lin', 'email': 'ricolin@ricolky.com', 'username': 'rico.lin'}, {'_account_id': 21909, 'name': 'Bob Fournier', 'email': 'bfournie@redhat.com', 'username': 'bfournie'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 24245, 'name': 'Harald Jens√•s', 'email': 'hjensas@redhat.com', 'username': 'harald.jensas'}, {'_account_id': 26340, 'name': 'Ilya Etingof', 'email': 'etingof@gmail.com', 'username': 'etingof'}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 11655, 'date': '2018-04-25 05:37:22.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 21909, 'date': '2018-04-25 19:29:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 26340, 'date': '2018-04-26 11:52:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2018-04-27 15:23:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 24245, 'date': '2018-04-27 15:56:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2018-04-27 18:36:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)

Thanks for the detailed bug report. Still getting my head around this.'}, {'account_id': 24245, 'date': '2018-04-29 13:33:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 8833, 'date': '2018-04-30 04:09:24.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> Is the problem specific to ports implicitly created by Heat?

AFAICT, this is only an issue (not specific to ironic) when implicit/internal ports are created by heat.

With a OS::Neutron::Port resource, in the replace flow, we send the the port_id to nova after detaching it from the old server (when creating the replacement), where as we try to create a new port for the new server implicit port.

I've pushed a functional test patch for clarity.

http://logs.openstack.org/81/564681/1/check/heat-functional-convg-mysql-lbaasv2/1195ee1/job-output.txt.gz#_2018-04-27_07_23_35_783180

With this patch, we may be end up with servers without any interface, if we do update rollback.

http://logs.openstack.org/81/564681/2/check/heat-functional-convg-mysql-lbaasv2/4e1d04d/job-output.txt.gz#_2018-04-27_09_42_19_833953

Though the above problem for rollback currently exists for the case where we don't use an OS::Neutron::Port or implicit port in heat (i.e we don't specify subnet in OS::Nova::Server and nova creates the port and deletes it when detaching)"}, {'account_id': 11655, 'date': '2018-04-30 21:19:11.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 11655, 'date': '2018-04-30 21:26:54.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

I've limited the scope of the patch based on some of the discussion to instances that are in ERROR state which would mean that we don't create problems for the rollback logic if stacks are updated/changed. In some ways that may never be feasible.

We may want to extend it to cover instances that have been DELETED but in the grand scheme I'm not sure that is really a case that we should spend braincells on."}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2018-04-30 23:35:19.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> AFAICT, this is only an issue (not specific to ironic) when implicit/internal ports are created by heat.
> 
> With a OS::Neutron::Port resource, in the replace flow, we send the the port_id to nova after detaching it from the old server (when creating the replacement), where as we try to create a new port for the new server implicit port.

Hmm, OK. Let me try to summarise and see if I'm getting this:

* Currently we detach all ports when preparing for a replace; we reattach external ports to the replacement server but for implicit ports we create new ones and leave the old ones orphaned.
* This breaks Nova regardless of whether we're using Ironic, because we may try to create new ports with the same IP address as existing ones. (Also, leaving orphans is bad; we should... uh... well, switch metaphors for sure.)
* In theory if we could find a way to reattach the implicit ports (hard because they're stored in resource_data and not accessible to the replacement resource) then that would solve the problem for VMs.
* But it wouldn't solve the problem for Ironic because the ports have been modified and are not reusable?
* Deleting the implicit ports when preparing for a replacement (as this patch does) solves the problem as far as implicit ports go, whether or not Ironic is involved.
* Externally-defined ports will still have the problem but it's specific to Ironic?
* Something something rollback <head explodes>
* We never roll back to a FAILED resource so we can ignore the rollback problem if we limit ourselves to only fixing the issue for FAILED resources.

Which parts did I get wrong?"}, {'account_id': 11655, 'date': '2018-05-01 18:43:36.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> 
 > Hmm, OK. Let me try to summarise and see if I'm getting this:
 > 
 > * Currently we detach all ports when preparing for a replace; we
 > reattach external ports to the replacement server but for implicit
 > ports we create new ones and leave the old ones orphaned.

Detach but don't cause any sort of unbinding action to occur in neutron since they are two separate actions.

 > * This breaks Nova regardless of whether we're using Ironic,
 > because we may try to create new ports with the same IP address as
 > existing ones. (Also, leaving orphans is bad; we should... uh...
 > well, switch metaphors for sure.)

+1 to switching metaphors, although I'm all out of metaphor suggestions.

I don't think it necessarily breaks nova although I hadn't thought of IP address re-use on the same subnet. I was only thinking from a standpoint of MAC address use. In reality, it is the same conundrum in a sense because both the MACs and IP addresses on a network need to be unique. If there are finite network resource or resources for instances, the current pattern and behavior ends up effectively blocking the stack from ever completing if there is not free resources left. That  may be a completely separate problem, and actually is in a sense by design... something something rollback *brain explosion*.

 > * In theory if we could find a way to reattach the implicit ports
 > (hard because they're stored in resource_data and not accessible to
 > the replacement resource) then that would solve the problem for
 > VMs.

I think in theory yes, but I think in actual practice it is also a bad idea because $things may have happened to the port, and that port may actually require re-binding... and that depending on metadata on the port configuration may cause configuration to be orphaned in an underlying network fabric. Something something *brainexplodes*

I guess heat could be taught to strip the binding data off a port which would unbind it... although we likely want a little further discussion there with those who best understand neutron's interaction with ml2 drivers and maybe some people actually using some of the more complex ml2 drivers.

 > * But it wouldn't solve the problem for Ironic because the ports
 > have been modified and are not reusable?

Exactly. I'm actually kind of convinced no port should be considered re-usable.

 > * Externally-defined ports will still have the problem but it's
 > specific to Ironic?

Correct.

 > * Something something rollback <head explodes>

Oh My! :)

 > * We never roll back to a FAILED resource so we can ignore the
 > rollback problem if we limit ourselves to only fixing the issue for
 > FAILED resources.

Seems logical.

 > 
 > Which parts did I get wrong?
Not much, Comments above w/r/t port re-use."}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2018-05-01 19:35:03.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

(2 comments)

The inner platform effect strikes again :(

This seems like it's tackling a useful subset of the problem in a fairly safe way, so I'm on board."}, {'account_id': 8833, 'date': '2018-05-02 06:55:24.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> Currently we detach all ports when preparing for a replace; we reattach external ports to the replacement server but for implicit ports we create new ones and leave the old ones orphaned.

We don't leave the implicit ports forever, we do delete them when deleting the old server resource. One of the reasons for deleting them late is to reuse them when doing a rollback from an update that causes replacement which fails. 


> In theory if we could find a way to reattach the implicit ports (hard because they're stored in resource_data and not accessible to the replacement resource) then that would solve the problem for VMs.
But it wouldn't solve the problem for Ironic because the ports have been modified and are not reusable?

Right. If there is anything specific to be done for the old ports to be reusable (rebinding etc, if at all), we should still do that. I'm still not very cleat as to why a neutron port can't be reusable by ironic.

> Deleting the implicit ports when preparing for a replacement (as this patch does) solves the problem as far as implicit ports go, whether or not Ironic is involved.

It would solve the issues (like ip/mac conflict) but would break the rollback flow unless we create a new port and use it with the old server as part of rollback.

> Externally-defined ports will still have the problem but it's specific to Ironic?

If a neutron port can never be reusable with ironic, I think it's a bigger problem and beyond the scope of heat?
 
> We never roll back to a FAILED resource so we can ignore the rollback problem if we limit ourselves to only fixing the issue for FAILED resources

If that's true (which sounds reasonable too, but I could not find the code related to that[1]), then probably the above would fix the limited case. 

Though I think there are situations where you can't even detach a port from a server in ERROR state[2]. 

[1] https://github.com/openstack/heat/blob/master/heat/engine/resource.py#L1443
[2] https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/master/nova/api/openstack/compute/attach_interfaces.py#L179"}, {'account_id': 11655, 'date': '2018-05-02 13:34:40.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)

> Right. If there is anything specific to be done for the old ports
 > to be reusable (rebinding etc, if at all), we should still do that.
 > I'm still not very cleat as to why a neutron port can't be reusable
 > by ironic.

Ironic utilizes DHCP to boot the machine, which means the DHCP server needs
to reply to the actual MAC of the hardware, not the fake MAC address neutron
assigned the port when it was created.

 > 
 > > Deleting the implicit ports when preparing for a replacement (as
 > this patch does) solves the problem as far as implicit ports go,
 > whether or not Ironic is involved.
 > 
 > It would solve the issues (like ip/mac conflict) but would break
 > the rollback flow unless we create a new port and use it with the
 > old server as part of rollback.

This is kind of why I've been thinking of only addressing it for instances
in an ERROR state out of nova... because I don't see how rollback could
rollback to an instance in an ERROR state and have a working stack.

 > 
 > > Externally-defined ports will still have the problem but it's
 > specific to Ironic?
 > 
 > If a neutron port can never be reusable with ironic, I think it's a
 > bigger problem and beyond the scope of heat?

Well, It shows readily with ironic since we reset the MAC address of the port 
 
Agreed, but I've been trying to indicate that I don't think any port is really
re-usable between instances where one has failed. Just attaching to a new instance
orphan configuration if it is elsewhere in the network, such as an instance getting
deployed to a different rack.

 > > We never roll back to a FAILED resource so we can ignore the
 > rollback problem if we limit ourselves to only fixing the issue for
 > FAILED resources
 > 
 > If that's true (which sounds reasonable too, but I could not find
 > the code related to that[1]), then probably the above would fix the
 > limited case.
 > 
 > Though I think there are situations where you can't even detach a
 > port from a server in ERROR state[2].

Ugh, Well deleting those ports via neutron would cause them to be detached
I guess... And if I remember correctly there really is only one way to get
a failed instance back up on its feet, which would be to attempt rebuild...
But only ironic spins that on the same physical node.

 > 
 > [1] https://github.com/openstack/heat/blob/master/heat/engine/resource.py#L1443
 > [2] https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/master/nova/api/openstack/compute/attach_interfaces.py#L179"}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2018-05-02 13:52:08.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> If that's true (which sounds reasonable too, but I could not find the code related to that[1]), then probably the above would fix the limited case. 

Hmmm, I expected that it would be handled here:
https://github.com/openstack/heat/blob/master/heat/engine/stack.py#L1422
but it is not. (Which in retrospect makes sense, because some resource types are not replaced on failure.) And as you pointed out, we call restore_prev_rsrc() before starting the update (which will check if the resource needs replacement). So that seems like a bug too :/"}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2018-05-02 13:57:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 11655, 'date': '2018-05-02 14:09:44.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 11655, 'date': '2018-05-03 17:25:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 24245, 'date': '2018-05-05 02:16:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 12404, 'date': '2018-05-07 10:52:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Hi as we now migrated from Launchpad to StoryBoard ( https://storyboard.openstack.org/#!/project_group/82 ), we needs to link from your patch to StoryBoard, as for how to provide the link, please reference `How to connect from Gerrit to StoryBoard` section in https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/Heat-StoryBoard-Migration-Info
Please help to add those keys to your commit message. Thank you.'}, {'account_id': 11655, 'date': '2018-05-07 13:28:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 24245, 'date': '2018-05-07 14:10:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 11655, 'date': '2018-05-07 16:40:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 11655, 'date': '2018-05-07 19:53:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2018-05-10 14:44:50.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2

I created story #2002001 to for the bug where we're calling restore_prev_rsrc() even on a FAILED resource that needs to be replaced. Once that is fixed we could update this to just check for the FAILED state, which is more efficient (avoids a call to Nova). (I also added a task to that story to do this, so we won't forget.)

In the meantime though, this seems fine."}, {'account_id': 11655, 'date': '2018-05-11 11:30:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Published edit on patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 11655, 'date': '2018-05-11 11:30:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

commit_message:
Delete internal ports for ERROR-ed nodes

Precreated ports are never deleted by nova,
thus heat must delete the ports that it creates
that are internal ports.

This is important when baremetal is used via
ironic where the MAC address of the port must
match the physical node. Neutron does not
permit duplicate MAC addresses, hence ports
can't be orphaned.

Change-Id: I965abefbb10c22a635c35e3a44d227045f33885c
Story: #1766763
Task: #18791

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-05-11 20:51:32.000000000', 'message': 'Restore Ambari with newer JDK security policies

Recent changes in JDK security policies disabled TLSv1, which is used
by default in the communications between ambari-agent and ambari-server.
More details here:
https://community.hortonworks.com/articles/188269/javapython-updates-and-ambari-agent-tls-settings.html

In order to restore the functionalities, two changes are needed:
- Ambari 2.4.3.0, a minor update in the 2.4.x line;
- a change in the ambari-agent configuration file to force a newer TLS.

Story: 2002012
Task: 19651
Change-Id: I3782ce9acb8c895e4e1f3fb9046b54f2a57acdbf
'}]
commit_message:
Restore Ambari with newer JDK security policies

Recent changes in JDK security policies disabled TLSv1, which is used
by default in the communications between ambari-agent and ambari-server.
More details here:
https://community.hortonworks.com/articles/188269/javapython-updates-and-ambari-agent-tls-settings.html

In order to restore the functionalities, two changes are needed:
- Ambari 2.4.3.0, a minor update in the 2.4.x line;
- a change in the ambari-agent configuration file to force a newer TLS.

Story: 2002012
Task: 19651
Change-Id: I3782ce9acb8c895e4e1f3fb9046b54f2a57acdbf

commit_message:
Update "auth_port" in install docs

Based on the change in Keystone Install Guide [1],
this patch replace port 35357 with 5000 for "auth_port" in docs.

For more details, please check similar changes which have been done
on other projects: Nova [2], Neutron [3], Cinder [4], Glance [5].

[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/562812

commit_message:
Fix license boilerplates

license boilerplates as docstring are included in automatically
generated documentation which leads to wrong formatting.

For example the indented hyperlink to the license is formatted as
quotation.

Change-Id: I9d6088ab48d6787f29b593bfa5445b6a84e99de7

commit_message:
Add Tests for Update Group Types and Specs

This patch adds the tempest tests for updating group types
and group type specs APIs in Cinder. It tests the following:

  * update group type
  * update group type specs

Change-Id: Iab979cf53d828e2ac592fd85273258bdcf650e53

commit_message:
Switch from sahara-file to tarballs.o.o for artifacts

Clean the few remaining links to artifacts that still uses sahara-files,
but they have been available on tarballs.openstack.org for a good while.

Story: 2001996
Task: 19627
Change-Id: Ie17550afc7216bce88af5e6164b74420db0040c0

Pypi url changed from [1] to [2]

[1] https://pypi.python.org/pypi/<package>

equals to instance's name.

It's better to get description from server dict.

Closes-Bug: #1770549

commit_message:
Get description from server dict

If we doesn't pass os-compute-api-version, the description will
equals to instance's name.

It's better to get description from server dict.

Change-Id: Ie74bfbe88250ca9c7ce3ee95c0cd643ecfcfc417
Closes-Bug: #1770549

Docs: ibm_storage_driver: Fix volume_driver path in documentation

The provided path is invalid. This patch corrects the path.

commit_message:
make bagpipe-bgp port easily changed

devstack part : honor BAGPIPE_SERVICE_PORT setting
This is useful, for instance, to set bagpipe-bgp
API port to something else than 8082 which is used
by skydive.

CLI utils part: have the CLI utils read /etc/bagpipe/bgp.conf
to use the API port configured there

Change-Id: I6cdffd6fc5595310b3069fa099cfccada85bbff3

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-05-11 15:14:29.000000000', 'message': "trunk: Start dhclient only if it's not running

There are distributions using daemons to monitor network interfaces,
like for example NetworkManager. Such daemons spawn dhclient by itself
which causes running double dhclients on guest VM. This patch
conditionally starts dhclient only if there is no other instance of it
running on the guest.

Change-Id: I9017aa6dad269c17cdf74c983910d4058bc8a95e
Closes-bug: #1770664
"}]
commit_message:
trunk: Start dhclient only if it's not running

There are distributions using daemons to monitor network interfaces,
like for example NetworkManager. Such daemons spawn dhclient by itself
which causes running double dhclients on guest VM. This patch
conditionally starts dhclient only if there is no other instance of it
running on the guest.

Change-Id: I9017aa6dad269c17cdf74c983910d4058bc8a95e
Closes-bug: #1770664

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-05-10 16:00:47.000000000', 'message': "libvirt: check image type before removing snapshots in _cleanup_resize

Change Ic683f83e428106df64be42287e2c5f3b40e73da4 added some disk
cleanup logic to _cleanup_resize because some image backends (Qcow2,
Flat and Ploop) will re-create the instance directory and disk.info
file when initializing the image backend object.

However, that change did not take into account volume-backed instances
being resized will not have a root disk *and* if the local disk is
shared storage, removing the instance directory effectively deletes
the instance files, like the console.log, on the destination host
as well. Change I29fac80d08baf64bf69e54cf673e55123174de2a was made
to resolve that issue.

However (see the pattern?), if you're doing a resize of a
volume-backed instance that is not on shared storage, we won't remove
the instance directory from the source host in _cleanup_resize. If the
admin then later tries to live migrate the instance back to that host,
it will fail with DestinationDiskExists in the pre_live_migration()
method.

This change is essentially a revert of
I29fac80d08baf64bf69e54cf673e55123174de2a and alternate fix for
Ic683f83e428106df64be42287e2c5f3b40e73da4. Since the root problem
is that creating certain imagebackend objects will recreate the
instance directory and disk.info on the source host, we simply need
to avoid creating the imagebackend object. The only reason we are
getting an imagebackend object in _cleanup_resize is to remove
image snapshot clones, which is only implemented by the Rbd image
backend. Therefore, we can check to see if the image type supports
clones and if not, don't go through the imagebackend init routine
that, for some, will recreate the disk.

Conflicts:
      nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/test_driver.py

NOTE(mriedem): The conflict is due to not having change
Icdd039bb4374269d9da38e7f8d2e15e05ca8aadb in Queens.

Change-Id: Ib10081150e125961cba19cfa821bddfac4614408
Closes-Bug: #1769131
Related-Bug: #1666831
Related-Bug: #1728603
(cherry picked from commit 8e3385707cb1ced55cd12b1314d8c0b68d354c38)
(cherry picked from commit 174764340d3c965d31143b39af4ab2e8ecefe594)

to avoid creating the imagebackend object. The only reason we are

commit_message:
libvirt: check image type before removing snapshots in _cleanup_resize

Change Ic683f83e428106df64be42287e2c5f3b40e73da4 added some disk
cleanup logic to _cleanup_resize because some image backends (Qcow2,
Flat and Ploop) will re-create the instance directory and disk.info
file when initializing the image backend object.

However, that change did not take into account volume-backed instances
being resized will not have a root disk *and* if the local disk is
shared storage, removing the instance directory effectively deletes
the instance files, like the console.log, on the destination host
as well. Change I29fac80d08baf64bf69e54cf673e55123174de2a was made
to resolve that issue.

However (see the pattern?), if you're doing a resize of a
volume-backed instance that is not on shared storage, we won't remove
the instance directory from the source host in _cleanup_resize. If the
admin then later tries to live migrate the instance back to that host,
it will fail with DestinationDiskExists in the pre_live_migration()
method.

This change is essentially a revert of
I29fac80d08baf64bf69e54cf673e55123174de2a and alternate fix for
Ic683f83e428106df64be42287e2c5f3b40e73da4. Since the root problem
is that creating certain imagebackend objects will recreate the
instance directory and disk.info on the source host, we simply need
to avoid creating the imagebackend object. The only reason we are
getting an imagebackend object in _cleanup_resize is to remove
image snapshot clones, which is only implemented by the Rbd image
backend. Therefore, we can check to see if the image type supports
clones and if not, don't go through the imagebackend init routine
that, for some, will recreate the disk.

Change-Id: Ib10081150e125961cba19cfa821bddfac4614408
Closes-Bug: #1769131
Related-Bug: #1666831
Related-Bug: #1728603
(cherry picked from commit 8e3385707cb1ced55cd12b1314d8c0b68d354c38)
(cherry picked from commit 174764340d3c965d31143b39af4ab2e8ecefe594)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-05-10 20:50:25.000000000', 'message': "Monitor phys_bridges to reconfigured it if created again

In case when external bridge configured in OVS agent's bridge_mappings
will be destroyed and created again (for example by running ifup-ovs
script on Centos) bridge wasn't configured by OVS agent.
That might cause broken connectivity for OpenStack's dataplane if
dataplane network also uses same bridge.

This patch adds additional ovsdb-monitor to monitor if any
of physical bridges configured in bridge_mappings was created.
If so, agent will reconfigure it to restore proper openflow rules
on it.

Change-Id: I9c0dc587e70327e03be5a64522d0c679665f79bd
Closes-Bug: #1768990
(cherry picked from commit 85b46cd51ebec67d5018d8bef4f796ee5ef4fedf)
"}]
commit_message:
Monitor phys_bridges to reconfigured it if created again

In case when external bridge configured in OVS agent's bridge_mappings
will be destroyed and created again (for example by running ifup-ovs
script on Centos) bridge wasn't configured by OVS agent.
That might cause broken connectivity for OpenStack's dataplane if
dataplane network also uses same bridge.

This patch adds additional ovsdb-monitor to monitor if any
of physical bridges configured in bridge_mappings was created.
If so, agent will reconfigure it to restore proper openflow rules
on it.

Change-Id: I9c0dc587e70327e03be5a64522d0c679665f79bd
Closes-Bug: #1768990
(cherry picked from commit 85b46cd51ebec67d5018d8bef4f796ee5ef4fedf)

commit_message:
IBM XIV: enable FC zoning to all the ports

Define FC host just considers connected FC target ports, which should
enable host to connect to all the storage FC ports for zoning.

Change-Id: Ibb20917c8ed80cb1413de1d61104d495605ec3df
Closes-Bug:#1759994
(cherry picked from commit 4ace160de4762f58566ec24723858a400956bc4b)

commit_message:
Stop using legacy nodesets

We in openstack-infra would like to remove these nodesets, our new
ones will provide the same functionality.

Change-Id: I5bd3f26f1624491bb3f211e2d777f29bdf7c0a37
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Remove ironic_host_manager usage

The baremetal scheduling options were deprecated
in Pike and the ironic_host_manager was deprecated
in Queens and has now been removed. Deployments
must use resource classes now for baremetal scheduling.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/565805/
Change-Id: I92cab1c7b5dc8201b0a8a94287c75d6348ab4465

commit_message:
fix tox py27 job

- The current py27 tox env only runs the
  unit tests for core os-vif lib.
- This change removes --test-path="os_vif/tests"
  to renable the unit tests for all  in tree plugins.

Change-Id: Ife09b596d7bb009e623c8b9edbd424b8fc6f2556

commit_message:
Tear down console during unprovisioning

Before this patch, when unprovisioning a node, the console was left
running. This allowed a user to view the console even after the instance
was gone. Stop the console during unprovisioning to block this.

ConductorManager._set_console_mode will now bubble up any exceptions
raised, so that we can explode as needed during unprovisioning. This
does not have any side effects, as elsewhere it is run in it's own
thread and execution was complete after handling the exception.

Also change a few mock.ANY in the relevant unit tests to the actual task
object, as cleanup.

Change-Id: Iec128444d692e0b0fbc1737eb21b0e6f69b7ec1e
Partial-Bug: #1769817
Story: #2002000
Task: #19634

commit_message:
Add ability to configure enabled_import_methods

Add new option glance::api::enabled_import_methods to support configuring
the list of enabled Image Import Methods.

Related-Bug: #1765439
Change-Id: Iea65b5e8a512d6a54cc88beb34d285ac797c58a9
(cherry picked from commit e223cc5d6bdd732fc9a93943fab99f7c2a42b041)

subject: Elaborate on tests from Quique
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-05-08 19:32:20.000000000', 'message': 'Elaborate on tests from Quique

I just put this up as a follow-up on top of Quique patch for
discussion, we can squash the changes together after discussing.

I think this is the full list of job/release combinations we
support, though it is worth reviewing. I removed undercloud ffu
upgrade, and added cases for the overcloud update as well as the
no update.

I also think we want the upgrade jobs to start off by using the
same release files they do today.

We also want tests for the unsupported combinations that
would assert failure with some useful message.

We will also need to a different type of unit test for the dlrn
hash part, since those should be an actual hash not a named hash.

Change-Id: I7ae2e7dd3ed1e49165aeaf0e443bf7c96be9dff7
'}]
commit_message:
Elaborate on tests from Quique

I just put this up as a follow-up on top of Quique patch for
discussion, we can squash the changes together after discussing.

I think this is the full list of job/release combinations we
support, though it is worth reviewing. I removed undercloud ffu
upgrade, and added cases for the overcloud update as well as the
no update.

I also think we want the upgrade jobs to start off by using the
same release files they do today.

We also want tests for the unsupported combinations that
would assert failure with some useful message.

We will also need to a different type of unit test for the dlrn
hash part, since those should be an actual hash not a named hash.

Change-Id: I7ae2e7dd3ed1e49165aeaf0e443bf7c96be9dff7

commit_message:
Uncap eventlet and sync requirements

We will manage the eventlet version using constraints now. See the
thread starting at
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-April/129096.html
for more details.

Meanwhile, it was necessary to address these issues in
check-requirements:

Package u'setuptools' is used in requirements.txt but not in
lower-constraints.txt

Package u'sphinx' is constrained to 1.6.5 which does not match the
minimum version specifier 1.6.2 in test-requirements.txt

Change-Id: Ie0e7b132acab2300e766ae57613a702db21b142f
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-05-11 16:43:56.000000000', 'message': 'Sanitize the config drive UUID

When cloud-init processes an instance to determine
if it is first boot or not, it compares the config
drive UUID with the VM UUID.  This change makes those
values the same now for a given VM / config drive pair.

Closes-Bug: #1770696
Change-Id: I128a0bc886b020d67241c67a874cf8d06e791b57
(cherry picked from commit 5d438733eb310b278d44aada7340a56ee9325063)
'}]
commit_message:
Sanitize the config drive UUID

When cloud-init processes an instance to determine
if it is first boot or not, it compares the config
drive UUID with the VM UUID.  This change makes those
values the same now for a given VM / config drive pair.

Closes-Bug: #1770696
Change-Id: I128a0bc886b020d67241c67a874cf8d06e791b57
(cherry picked from commit 5d438733eb310b278d44aada7340a56ee9325063)

commit_message:
Fix sphinx-docs job for stable branch

build-openstack-sphinx-docs jobs fails on stable branches due to the new
pip version 10 introduces some previously Warning as Error: in case of
calling "pip install" without any package name, the command fails.
tox_install.sh is called during docs job without any package passed to
pip.

Change-Id: I2b525e6f9ef649e21fe68a1a50b7571d13ca27e9
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>

commit_message:
[docs] Fix lint failures

This patch fixes:

doc/source/contributor/testing.rst:281: D000 Explicit markup ends without a blank line; unexpected unindent.
doc/source/user/test/example.rst:28: D001 Line too long
doc/source/admin/maintenance-tasks.rst:8: D000 Title level inconsistent:
doc/source/admin/maintenance-tasks.rst:22: D000 Title level inconsistent:
doc/source/admin/troubleshooting.rst:630: D001 Line too long
doc/source/admin/troubleshooting.rst:650: D001 Line too long
doc/source/admin/maintenance-tasks/inventory-backups.rst:11: D001 Line too long

For consistency between maintenance-tasks/ files, they now all
have the same markup hierarchy.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/567804
Change-Id: Id1cf9cb45543daa7c39d5141d8dc5827a76c6413

[{'created': '2018-05-11 13:28:17.000000000', 'message': 'Update repo_server SHA

This pulls in the lsync permissions fix. The  /var/www/repo/pools
is owned by root:root on the slave repo containers, this fix
changes them to be owned nginx:www-data and allows lsync to properly
push the packages.

Change-Id: Ie6eb16d04f65db7b7552ef39ae3b085c049e9b48
'}]
commit_message:
Update repo_server SHA

This pulls in the lsync permissions fix. The  /var/www/repo/pools
is owned by root:root on the slave repo containers, this fix
changes them to be owned nginx:www-data and allows lsync to properly
push the packages.

Change-Id: Ie6eb16d04f65db7b7552ef39ae3b085c049e9b48

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-05-01 14:20:17.000000000', 'message': "increment consumer generation when allocs change

Modifies the AllocationList.set_allocations() routine to increment
impacted consumers' generation. When a Consumer object is present in the
Allocation object, its generation is incremented.

When no Consumer object is in an Allocation, that means the API layer
was unable to find a Consumer record for an existing allocation that was
created before project and user were required fields. So, clearly there
is no generation to increment in this case.

Change-Id: I0f2acff140279d6d092f43936acc12eac5459431
blueprint: add-consumer-generation
"}, {'created': '2018-05-01 14:34:44.000000000', 'message': "increment consumer generation when allocs change

Modifies the AllocationList.set_allocations() routine to increment
impacted consumers' generation. When a Consumer object is present in the
Allocation object, its generation is incremented.

When no Consumer object is in an Allocation, that means the API layer
was unable to find a Consumer record for an existing allocation that was
created before project and user were required fields. So, clearly there
is no generation to increment in this case.

Change-Id: I0f2acff140279d6d092f43936acc12eac5459431

commit_message:
increment consumer generation when allocs change

Modifies the AllocationList.set_allocations() routine to increment
impacted consumers' generations. When a Consumer object is present in
the Allocation object, its generation is incremented.

When no Consumer object is in an Allocation, that means the API layer
was unable to find a Consumer record for an existing allocation that was
created before project and user were required fields. So, clearly there
is no generation to increment in this case.

Change-Id: I0f2acff140279d6d092f43936acc12eac5459431
blueprint: add-consumer-generation

- nova-dsvm-full-tempest http://cloudbase-ci.com/nova/565403/9/ : SUCCESS in 2h 25m 13s'}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2018-05-10 13:30:42.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 9: Code-Review-1

Can you expand on the commit message please to explain why objects for project and user are going to be necessary? It may be obvious further in the stack but here in isolation it is not. With my existing understanding of consumers, projet and user are just attributes of Consumer, not independent things in their own right, but this code reifies them as such, but doesn't explain why, either in the commit nor in docstrings.

So -1 on that. The rest is just commentary.

The record for how we reached this change isn't clear to me. I leave for a week, thinking that we've decided that we're not going to use even a Consumer object, and come back to find that we've got three new objects. It's not clear how that happened.

It's not simply that I don't like overusing objects, more that there's a picture fo things which either isn't clearly documented, or any new decision making has not been linked into the world in a discoverable way. That makes it hard to review effectively and to be honest, feels a bit like a fait accompli: The people who are in the know, because they happen to be around, are making things happen, perhaps because there is a (probably false, or at least not fully shared and published) sense of urgency.

From the standpoint of trying to be inclusive of less active participants, we're not doing as good a job on this front as we could."}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2018-05-10 15:07:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

> Can you expand on the commit message please to explain why objects
 > for project and user are going to be necessary? It may be obvious
 > further in the stack but here in isolation it is not. With my
 > existing understanding of consumers, projet and user are just
 > attributes of Consumer, not independent things in their own right,
 > but this code reifies them as such, but doesn't explain why, either
 > in the commit nor in docstrings.
 > 
 > So -1 on that. The rest is just commentary.

Sure I can do that.

 > The record for how we reached this change isn't clear to me. I
 > leave for a week, thinking that we've decided that we're not going
 > to use even a Consumer object, and come back to find that we've got
 > three new objects. It's not clear how that happened.

Not sure how you thought that "we decided that we've not going to use even a Consumer object". Perhaps you are referring to Ed's last patch that he had proposed that didn't use any objects because he said the objects made the code too complex.

I didn't agree, and I started a patch series to show how we could make the consumer/project/user creation more consistent and remove the non-germane attributes like 'enforce_consumer_generation' from the object definitions. This is the result of that. The original patch series I pushed up didn't attempt to create consumer records for allocations that were created before 1.8. Dan wanted to see consumer records created all the time and wanted to have missing consumer records created with a project and user that would be configurable. So, I changed the bottom patch to create those missing consumer records.

 > It's not simply that I don't like overusing objects, more that
 > there's a picture fo things which either isn't clearly documented,
 > or any new decision making has not been linked into the world in a
 > discoverable way. That makes it hard to review effectively and to
 > be honest, feels a bit like a fait accompli: The people who are in
 > the know, because they happen to be around, are making things
 > happen, perhaps because there is a (probably false, or at least not
 > fully shared and published) sense of urgency.

Please don't think this. There was nothing nefarious going on. I had a simple disagreement on what I'd like the object code to look like and I pushed a patch series to show that we could make the object code simply plain-ol'-data objects and leave the microversion-originating logic in the handler code.

-jay'}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2018-05-10 15:11:02.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 9:

> Please don't think this. There was nothing nefarious going on. I
 > had a simple disagreement on what I'd like the object code to look
 > like and I pushed a patch series to show that we could make the
 > object code simply plain-ol'-data objects and leave the
 > microversion-originating logic in the handler code.

I don't think there was anything nefarious going on. Just simply that for someone who isn't paying close attention (for whatever reason) it is hard to track decision making, and we can (and should, nay must) do better on that front."}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2018-05-11 19:08:43.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/567678/'}]

placement: add Project, User and Consumer objects

Makes Project, User, and Consumer actual things in the placement object
modeling.

Change-Id: I83e7d7f2f75b1f3e288bc3855e40077a2446a511
blueprint: add-consumer-generation

commit_message:
Add create() methods to Project, User and Consumer

Following patches need to create project and user records along with
consumer records. This patch adds the infrastructure on the Project,
User and Consumer objects for creating them in the DB.

Change-Id: Idd4fdd060e711d9aa32108015bb36ace04f0ede6
blueprint: add-consumer-generation

commit_message:
Support DHCP for managed network interfaces

Adds support for setting the boot protocol of a network interface. Valid values
are 'static' and 'dhcp'.  The default is 'static'. When set to 'dhcp', an
external DHCP server must be provided.

Change-Id: Ie4cafdcd24c6706009ca9e8accac2017d7d6bba7
Story: 2001967
Task: 15717

Well, it's not like we're turning it off, and we can always go back to permissive for a period of time if someone wants to consider running it in enforcing mode, when/if that's ever supported by Kolla."}, {'account_id': 16984, 'date': '2018-05-10 16:42:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-05-09 18:15:12.000000000', 'message': "Configure SELinux state in kolla ansible

Kolla ansible now provides the ability to change the SELinux mode, and does so
by default. The default mode is 'permissive', whereas kayobe sets it to
'disabled' in the disable-selinux role.  This results in a flip-flop effect as
the two fight, and worse - kayobe will reboot the system to apply the change
on subsequent runs of 'kayobe <seed|controller> host configure'.

This change configures the selinux mode for kolla ansible to be 'disabled' to
avoid this issue.

TrivialFix

Change-Id: I53e1d431ecd5ddb602f41b197ac482c3ed89d1d9
"}, {'created': '2018-05-10 16:12:50.000000000', 'message': "Configure SELinux state in kolla ansible

Kolla ansible now provides the ability to change the SELinux mode, and does so
by default. The default mode is 'permissive', whereas kayobe sets it to
'disabled' in the disable-selinux role.  This results in a flip-flop effect as
the two fight, and worse - kayobe will reboot the system to apply the change
on subsequent runs of 'kayobe <seed|controller> host configure'.

This change configures the selinux mode for kolla ansible to be 'disabled' to
avoid this issue.

TrivialFix

Change-Id: I53e1d431ecd5ddb602f41b197ac482c3ed89d1d9
"}]
commit_message:
Configure SELinux state in kolla ansible

Kolla ansible now provides the ability to change the SELinux mode, and does so
by default. The default mode is 'permissive', whereas kayobe sets it to
'disabled' in the disable-selinux role.  This results in a flip-flop effect as
the two fight, and worse - kayobe will reboot the system to apply the change
on subsequent runs of 'kayobe <seed|controller> host configure'.

This change configures the selinux mode for kolla ansible to be 'disabled' to
avoid this issue.

TrivialFix

Change-Id: I53e1d431ecd5ddb602f41b197ac482c3ed89d1d9

commit_message:
Allow resolv.conf configuration to be prevented

In some cases we may wish to use an existing DNS resolver configuration, or to
acquire the configuration via a protocol such as DHCP. In these cases the
variable resolv_is_managed should be set to false.

Change-Id: I1e4661f3eedd87da15142d2d6815aaeb0493be6c
Story: 2001967
Task: 15718

commit_message:
Build release notes using reno

The current approach of adding release notes to a single file means that
we end up with merge conflicts every time a change is merged. This is
wasteful of time and resources.

Change-Id: I19f956e4e3991e39252eaa3a1b97a3b2812858d2
Story: 2001637
Task: 6649

I'd like to continue. IMO the patch is mostly done.

We need a new ryu release, which should happen in the beginning of the next month, and need to switch to OF1.4.
OF1.4 worked ok when I tested here, but some glitches are possible."}, {'account_id': 9200, 'date': '2017-11-07 09:07:47.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 9200, 'date': '2017-11-08 02:50:23.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 9200, 'date': '2017-11-22 01:24:12.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8:

 > the next month, and need to switch to OF1.4.
 > OF1.4 worked ok when I tested here, but some glitches are possible.

The alternative is to use ONF bundle extension and stick with OF1.3, which needs to be implemented on ryu.

IMO, OF1.4 implementation in ryu isn't much tested and this is a safer and conservative approach."}, {'account_id': 9200, 'date': '2017-12-20 09:25:53.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 9.'}, {'account_id': 9200, 'date': '2018-01-16 01:35:28.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 10.'}, {'account_id': 8655, 'date': '2018-01-19 16:15:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10:

commit_message:
Update lower constraints for openstacksdk to 0.13.0

Currently 'masakari-monitors' and 'python-masakariclient' are
broken. Please refer to the bug reported [1] and ML discussion [2].
The fix [3] is merged in openstacksdk 0.13.0. This patch bumps the
lower-constraints for openstacksdk so that it fixes the
masakari-monitors and python-masakariclient completly.

[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/python-masakariclient/+bug/1756047
[2] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack/2018-May/046469.html
[3] https://github.com/openstack/openstacksdk/commit/ad545ef35c3da083bb13b4d7dac1620fddface29

Change-Id: I17fec5de87cd9f58aa26b589c7bb22f2509b602f

commit_message:
Allow cleaning up non-existant group assignments

If a group gets deleted out-of-band in an LDAP environment, the role
assignments cannot be cleaned as it checks the existence of the group
before triggering the deletion. This fix adds the ability to ignore
non-existant group and clean up stale role assignments. We take the
same approach with user assignments.

Co-Authored-By: Lance Bragstad <lbragstad@gmail.com>

Change-Id: I975c8325f50b412c3aa256e1940a27082c009cce
Closes-Bug: #1751045

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-05-08 12:47:47.000000000', 'message': 'test-log-collect.sh: Fix log collection for host

The lxc_cmd variable is being set when we collect log information for
containers but it is not unset when we do the same thing on the host. As
a result of which, the host repo and pkg logs were wrong since they were
collected from the last container instead of the host.

Change-Id: If2d0a84b46538e44f383967108ca9f67e91f5054
'}]
commit_message:
test-log-collect.sh: Fix log collection for host

The lxc_cmd variable is being set when we collect log information for
containers but it is not unset when we do the same thing on the host. As
a result of which, the host repo and pkg logs were wrong since they were
collected from the last container instead of the host.

Change-Id: If2d0a84b46538e44f383967108ca9f67e91f5054

Scan all affiliations and take the latest one that has a start date
that makes it valid for the date in question. This works around the

it difficult for users to modify their existing affiliations.

Change-Id: I369d777e0ef2064fc728f9042d9b0e3eca84d350

commit_message:
be more forgiving of bad affiliation date ranges

Scan all affiliations and take the latest one that has a start date
that makes it valid for the date in question. This works around the
fact that there is a bug in the web UI for the foundation site making
it difficult for users to modify their existing affiliations.

Change-Id: I369d777e0ef2064fc728f9042d9b0e3eca84d350
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

messages: [{'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2018-05-11 16:24:57.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2018-05-11 16:25:51.000000000', 'content': 'Topic changed from pike to fix-tox-install'}, {'account_id': 16710, 'date': '2018-05-11 16:39:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 10608, 'date': '2018-05-11 16:48:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-05-11 16:24:57.000000000', 'message': 'Use "$*" instead of "$@" in tox_install.sh

Checking for no arguments via

[ -z "$@" ]

works if there's zero or one arguments, but breaks if there's more than
one:

[: too many arguments

Checking via

[ -z "$*" ]

does not suffer this malady.

Co-Authored-By: Elod Illes <elod.illes@ericsson.com>

Change-Id: Ieb36a775c6a1db027e0be684851582265fbb5f48
'}]
commit_message:
Use "$*" instead of "$@" in tox_install.sh

Checking for no arguments via

[ -z "$@" ]

works if there's zero or one arguments, but breaks if there's more than
one:

[: too many arguments

Checking via

[ -z "$*" ]

does not suffer this malady.

Co-Authored-By: Elod Illes <elod.illes@ericsson.com>

Change-Id: Ieb36a775c6a1db027e0be684851582265fbb5f48
